Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Management (MSEM) is designed for graduates of engineering, technology, science, and other similar technical programs to prepare them for management or leadership roles in a technical or technology-driven organization. The MSEM degree program can be pursued as either a thesis or non-thesis option. The program consists of 33 semester hours of coursework. All students take five core courses. The remaining 18 credit hours (six courses) are electives. For students pursuing the thesis option, six of these elective hours will be thesis credits. Those on the non-thesis option track must take the capstone course, EMGT 6950, as one of their six electives. The M.S. in Engineering Management provides students with: an understanding of financial and cost accounting in decision-making in a business environment; an understanding of the management of engineering and technology-based projects, especially on project constraints, such as time, cost, and performances; an understanding of managing technical personnel and the technical functions within an organization; an understanding of quality management concepts and their applications; the ability to conduct research and present results in written and oral forms; and the ability to solve a wide variety of engineering management problems.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Athletic Training
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Minimum scores: TOEFL 71 iBT or 525 PBT; IELTS 6.0; PTE academic 54; Duolingo English Test 100; or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Science in Athletic Training program is a two-step process requiring admission to the College of Graduate Studies and the MS-AT Program. Applications must be submitted through the Athletic Training Centralized Application System (ATCAS). The ATCAS application requires official transcripts, three letters of recommendation, a personal statement, a minimum of 50 hours of clinical observation with a certified athletic trainer (ATC), completion of prerequisite coursework, a minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA, and a minimum 3.0 prerequisite GPA. GRE scores are not required.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training is a 5-semester, 58 credit hour professional program which prepares students to sit for the Board of Certification (BOC) exam and to enter the athletic training profession. Students will complete a variety of clinical experiences, including MTSU athletic teams, local high schools, physician offices, and outpatient rehabilitation clinics. Students will learn how to provide whole-person health care for their patients, which includes prevention, diagnosis, and intervention of emergency, acute, and chronic medical conditions involving impairment, functional limitations, and disabilities. The athletic training program is housed in the Department of Health and Human Performance within the College of Behavioral and Health Sciences. The program accepts a new cohort each summer (May) semester.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE). The program is currently on probation, effective February 19, 2023.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Engineering Technology (Occupational Health and Safety)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. MTSU accepts TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, and Duolingo.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Science degree program in Engineering Technology requires an undergraduate degree in a technical or technology-related discipline from an accredited university or college. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale is required for unconditional admission. Applicants with a GPA between 2.50 and 2.74 may be conditionally admitted. Conditional status is removed upon satisfactory completion of 9 semester hours of graduate work with a GPA of 3.00 or better. Applicants with an undergraduate degree in a non-technical or technology-related discipline will be required to demonstrate proficiency in at least three of the seven areas of study: algebra, trigonometry, chemistry, physics, statistics, circuit analysis, and statics and/or dynamics. This proficiency may be met by satisfactory completion of an undergraduate course or by a departmental examination. The following materials should also be sent directly to the Graduate Studies Office: one copy of all college transcripts; three letters of recommendation; an official report of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Engineering Technology (M.S.E.T.) is a 30-credit-hour, 100% online program designed to serve the needs of students with undergraduate degrees in technology, engineering, or related science disciplines. The program consists of a 15-credit-hour core and two 15-credit-hour concentration options: Aviation Technology and Occupational Health and Safety. The curriculum provides advanced study for graduate students to develop professional competencies in areas of teaching, training, and administration to create pathways to leadership positions in business and industry, government, and education.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting an acceptable score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), Duolingo English Test, or by completing the English for international students program.
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies.

Applicants must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.

Must have a satisfactory score on the Graduate Record Exam (GRE).

A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.00 is required for unconditional admission.

A Statement of Purpose must be submitted with the application.

Three letters of recommendation must be submitted with the application.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Science program provides a comprehensive study of the theoretical and practical aspects of exercise physiology, biomechanics, and motor behavior. This program is designed to prepare students for careers in clinical, corporate, and academic settings involving physical activity, exercise, and sport. Students develop skills in exercise testing and prescription for a variety of populations. The program also provides excellent preparation for doctoral study in exercise science and related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Minimum $10,000 stipend for the academic year

EnglishScore: Applicants must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL: 71 iBT, 525 PBT; IELTS: 6.0; PTE Academic: 48; Duolingo: 100; ELS: 112; Completion of a degree from a U.S. institution; Citizenship of a country from the English-speaking countries list.
Department: University College
Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is an interdisciplinary master’s degree program designed to meet the workforce development needs of the 21st century. The M.P.S. is designed for working adults who wish to develop a set of advanced professional skills that they can apply in their current work environment and also earn a graduate degree. The Leadership in Nutrition concentration is an online, 30-credit hour program that provides students who have completed the Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD) requirements with an innovative opportunity to build upon their undergraduate nutrition knowledge base by developing graduate level leadership skills that will enhance their professional marketability in the field of nutrition and dietetics. This non-thesis program requires 15 credit hours of core Professional Studies courses and 15 credit hours of Nutrition and Food Science (NFS) courses focused on building leadership and research skills. A capstone project is required.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by submitting official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test, or by successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
Candidates seeking admission to the Master of Science in Nursing must submit a graduate application.

In addition to the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies, the School of Nursing requires applicants to meet the following criteria to be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Nursing program:

1.  Baccalaureate degree in nursing from a program accredited by the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN) or the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCME)
2.  Current, unencumbered license to practice as a registered nurse in Tennessee or the state in which the student will complete clinical practicum requirements
3.  A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all undergraduate coursework is required for unconditional admission. Students with GPAs between 2.75 and 2.99 may be considered for conditional admission. The GRE is not required.
4.  One year of full-time work experience or its equivalent as a registered nurse.
5.  Submission of the following to the College of Graduate Studies:
    *   an application for admission
    *   official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended
    *   three letters of recommendation (one of which is from the current or most recent employer) addressing the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program
    *   current resume
    *   statement of purpose describing professional goals
Department: School of Nursing
Description: The Master of Science in Nursing program at MTSU has two concentrations. The Family Nurse Practitioner concentration prepares students to provide primary care to individuals across the lifespan in a variety of settings. The Nursing Education concentration prepares students for roles as educators in a variety of settings. The master's program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education.
Accredidation: The master's program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education.

ProgramName: Master in Nursing, Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores are TOEFL iBT 71, IELTS 6.0, PTE Academic 53, or Duolingo 95. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted. Students from countries where English is the official language or the medium of instruction may be exempt.
Requirements:
Applicants must have a B.S.N. from a nationally accredited program. Applicants who have completed an Associate Degree in Nursing and a bachelor’s degree in another field may apply for provisional admission and complete a portfolio review.
Applicants must be eligible for graduate study at MTSU.
Applicants must submit a College of Graduate Studies application.
Applicants must have a current, unencumbered Tennessee registered nurse (RN) license or a license from a compact state.
Applicants must submit evidence of having completed a three-hour undergraduate course in statistics with a C or better.
Applicants must have a grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Applicants are required to submit an essay that describes professional goals, why they chose the PMHNP specialty, and how they see the PMHNP role evolving.
Applicants are required to submit a professional résumé.
Applicants will complete a faculty interview.
Applicants are required to have one year of experience as an R.N. prior to beginning clinical courses.
Department: School of Nursing
Description: The Master of Science in Nursing (M.S.N.) with a concentration as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) prepares registered nurses for advanced practice in a variety of settings across the lifespan. Emphasis is on health promotion and disease prevention as well as the diagnosis and management of acute and chronic mental health problems. Successful graduates of the PMHNP concentration are prepared to sit for the ANCC Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (Across the Lifespan) Certification (PMHNP-BC™) exam. The MTSU School of Nursing's M.S.N. program is an online program.
Accredidation: The master’s degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, (202) 887-6791.

Requirements:
Applicants seeking admission to the Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies program must have an earned bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit an application through the Centralized Application Service for Physician Assistants (CASPA). Applications will be screened based on the applicant’s academic record and references. Meeting the minimum requirements for admission does not guarantee an interview. Selected applicants will be invited for an interview. Applicants will be evaluated based on their motivation to become a physician assistant, their understanding of the role of a physician assistant, their academic aptitude, their communication and interpersonal skills, and their maturity and stability. Acceptance into the program is provisional and contingent upon a successful background check. Specific admission requirements include:

1. Minimum overall GPA of 3.0.
2. Minimum science GPA of 3.0.
3. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better.
4. Completion of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) with a recommended score of 150 on both verbal and quantitative sections and a score of 3.5 on the analytical writing section.
5. Three letters of recommendation.
6. A minimum of 500 hours of direct patient care experience.
7. Completion of a successful background check.
8. Completion of the CASPer exam.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Master in Physician Assistant Studies (M.P.A.S.) is designed to provide a comprehensive academic and clinical medical education to prepare physician assistants for their professional roles as healthcare providers. Graduates will be eligible to take the Physician Assistant National Certifying Exam (PANCE).
Accredidation:
The ARC-PA has granted Accreditation-Provisional status to the Middle Tennessee State University Physician Assistant Program sponsored by Middle Tennessee State University.

Accreditation-Provisional is an accreditation status granted when the plans and resource allocation, if fully implemented as planned, of a proposed program that has not yet enrolled students appear to demonstrate the program’s ability to meet the ARC-PA Standards or when a program holding Accreditation-Provisional status appears to demonstrate continued progress in complying with the Standards as it prepares for the graduation of the first class (cohort) of students.

Accreditation-Provisional does not ensure any subsequent accreditation status. It is limited to no more than five years from matriculation of the first class.
MinimumGreScore: 300 or greater and analytical writing score of 4.0 or greater

ProgramName: Master of Education in Curriculum and Instruction
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English language proficiency. Acceptable tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL (71 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (100), or ELS (completion of Level 112).
Requirements:
Admission to the Master of Education (M.Ed.) and Education Specialist (Ed.S.) requires a minimum score on the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) or the Miller Analogies Test (MAT) and an undergraduate grade point average of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. To be admitted to the M.Ed. in Curriculum and Instruction program, applicants must have a valid teaching license.

Admission standards are as follows:

Unconditional admission may be granted to applicants who meet the following:
- hold a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a minimum 2.75 GPA;
- have a valid teaching license; and
- have an acceptable score on the GRE (800 verbal and quantitative on the old test; 286 on the new test) or the MAT (380).

Conditional admission may be granted to applicants who meet the following:
- hold a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a minimum 2.50 GPA;
- have a valid teaching license; and
- have an acceptable score on the GRE (750 verbal and quantitative on the old test; 281 on the new test) or the MAT (370).
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['Elementary School Education', 'Middle Grades Education', 'Secondary School Education']
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Curriculum and Instruction is designed to serve the needs of currently licensed teachers seeking an advanced degree. Candidates select one of the following areas of emphasis: elementary school education, middle grades education, or secondary school education. The program consists of a 15-hour core and 15 hours in the area of emphasis. The final course in the program is a capstone experience where candidates complete an action research project in their own classroom or school. The program may lead to a professional teacher's license in states with a tiered licensure system.
Accredidation: MTSU's Educator Preparation Program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The next accreditation visit is scheduled for Fall 2024.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Digital Teaching and Learning
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by submitting official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo, or Pearson Test of English (PTE). The minimum acceptable score on the TOEFL is 79 (internet-based) or 550 (paper-based). The minimum acceptable score on the IELTS is a 6.0. The minimum Duolingo score is 110. The minimum PTE Academic score is 58. Proficiency can also be demonstrated by successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the M.Ed. in Curriculum and Instruction requires an undergraduate degree with a minimum GPA of 2.75. To apply for admission to the Master of Education program, applicants should submit an application with the appropriate application fee (online at www.mtsu.edu/graduate/apply.php), submit official transcripts of all previous college work, and submit three letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) in Curriculum and Instruction with a concentration in Teaching and Innovation in PK-16 is a 30-hour, fully online graduate degree program. Courses are provided online in 8-week formats. The program can be completed in as little as three semesters. The degree program is designed to provide teachers, administrators, and other educators in a variety of learning environments the knowledge, skills, and dispositions to be leaders in PK–16 education. The program focuses on curriculum, instruction, assessment, and innovation across the PK–16 spectrum. A distinctive feature of the program is the opportunity for students to tailor their program of study to fit their needs by selecting from a variety of graduate level elective courses to complete the required 9 hours of electives. Students will also be involved in an authentic, job-embedded action research project to impact student learning in their current professional settings.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Elementary School Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by providing an acceptable score on the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, or by completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the M.Ed. in Curriculum and Instruction requires
1. an earned bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college;
2. an undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or a master's degree.

Unconditional admission requires a minimum 2.75 undergraduate GPA.
Applicants who have a master's degree are not required to meet the 2.75 GPA.

The GRE is not required for admission to this program.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) with a major in Curriculum and Instruction offers concentrations for candidates who currently hold a teaching license and those who are seeking an initial teaching license. The Elementary School Education concentration is for candidates who have a valid Tennessee teaching license or a comparable license from another state. The program is designed for currently practicing elementary education teachers who want to strengthen their content knowledge and pedagogy with the goal of improving their practice. MTSU’s program focuses on developing advanced skills that will allow teachers to become leaders in their schools and school districts. The program will deepen candidates’ understanding of the teaching and learning processes with students from diverse backgrounds and across a range of abilities. All courses are delivered online with a combination of synchronous and asynchronous learning activities.
Accredidation: The Educator Preparation Program at MTSU is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The program is also approved by the Tennessee State Department of Education.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Higher Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. MTSU has several options available for students to prove English proficiency, including TOEFL (71 iBT / 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo English Test (100), or ELS (Level 112).
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Education in Higher Education requires an earned bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college; an undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or a 3.0 on the last 60 hours of undergraduate work; and submission of an acceptable writing sample (prompt can be obtained from the program coordinator); OR submission of an official report of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) score. The GRE is waived with a 3.0 undergraduate GPA.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education in Higher Education is designed to prepare graduate students for a variety of administrative and leadership roles in postsecondary settings including two- and four-year colleges and universities. The program provides an overview of higher education in the United States, including its history and development, its organization and structure, its functions and missions, its contemporary conditions and challenges, and the issues it will likely face in the future. The program of study covers student affairs, general administration, and academic affairs. Required coursework focuses on American higher education, characteristics of college students, campus diversity, educational research, student development theory, leadership, and legal issues. The curriculum is delivered through a cohort model in a fully online or hybrid format.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This is a requirement for admission to the university and cannot be waived. MTSU requires ONE of the following for admission to a graduate program: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 71; IELTS minimum overall band score of 6.0; PTE Academic minimum score of 52; Duolingo English Test minimum score of 100; successful completion of ELS Level 112, Intensive Program; Michigan Language Assessment (MELAB) minimum score of 77; or Cambridge English Scale score of 175.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) with a major in Literacy is a 33-hour, non-thesis program designed to prepare certified teachers to work as literacy coaches, reading specialists, and literacy leaders in their schools and districts. Students in this program will learn to use a variety of assessment tools to diagnose reading difficulties; design and deliver culturally responsive reading interventions for students in grades K-12; and provide professional development, coaching, and leadership to classroom teachers and other school personnel in support of school-wide literacy initiatives. Successful completion of this program and a passing score on the Praxis exam (5302) leads to licensure as a PreK-12 Reading Specialist in the state of Tennessee. In addition, candidates who complete this program will have the opportunity to participate in a graduate-level practicum experience in the Center for Dyslexia. Graduates will also have met coursework requirements for Wilson Dyslexia Practitioner Level I certification and will be ready to begin the observation year. Admission is for the fall semester only; all classes are offered online.
Accredidation: The program is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The Reading Specialist program is also nationally recognized by the International Literacy Association (ILA).

ProgramName: Master of Education in Special Education
EnglishScore: All graduate applicants who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents must provide proof of English language proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (525 paper-based or 71 Internet-based), IELTS (overall band score of 6), PTE Academic (overall score of 54), or Duolingo (score of 105).
Requirements:
To be admitted to the Master of Education in Special Education program, applicants should have one of the following:

*   a valid teaching license or
*   an undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Department: College of Education
Concentration: ['PreK-8 Special Education Interventionist', '6-12 Special Education Interventionist']
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree with a major in Special Education is an advanced degree designed for individuals who hold a valid teaching license and who wish to obtain an add-on endorsement in Special Education or who wish to seek a master’s degree in Special Education. The Special Education, M.Ed. can be completed entirely online. The program requires 33-36 semester hours and may be completed within two years. Candidates choose one of two concentrations: the PreK-8 Special Education Interventionist concentration or the 6-12 Special Education Interventionist concentration.
Accredidation: The special education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must present a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 71 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); a minimum score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 51 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE), or a minimum score of 100 on the Duolingo test. Other proof of English proficiency may be accepted upon review. Applicants who have received a degree from an institution in the United States may be exempt from this requirement.
Requirements: To be admitted to the Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) program, applicants should have a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a minimum 2.75 GPA. Applicants who do not meet this GPA requirement may be considered for conditional admission. The GRE is not required for admission. For more information, contact the program coordinator. In addition to the application for admission to the College of Graduate Studies, students must submit a statement of purpose and a resume.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is a 30- or 33-credit hour graduate degree designed for working professionals who wish to develop or enhance specific professional skills and advance in their careers. The M.P.S. in Training and Development is a unique, innovative, and attractive program which integrates the knowledge and skill of leadership development with strategic planning. Students gain a better understanding of how people learn and how to best address leadership issues from an educational and learning perspective. Graduates work in a variety of leadership and training positions in business, industry, government, and non-profit settings.

ProgramName: Concentration in Master of Professional Studies - Leadership in Nutrition
EnglishScore: International students must demonstrate English language proficiency. Acceptable proof includes a TOEFL iBT score of 71 or higher, an IELTS overall band score of 6.0 or higher, a PTE Academic score of 54 or higher, a Duolingo score of 100 or higher, or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) program requires an earned bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college; and an undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale for regular admission or a 2.50 for conditional admission. Applicants must also submit a statement of purpose and a professional résumé to the College of Graduate Studies.
Department: University College
Description: The Master of Professional Studies (M.P.S.) is a 30-33-credit hour graduate degree program with a unique interdisciplinary approach designed to equip students with the skills and competencies required by employers in their chosen professional fields. The degree is nationally recognized and respected. The Leadership in Nutrition concentration is a specialized track designed to broaden the knowledge base and skills of individuals working in nutrition-related fields. The required coursework covers current topics in advanced human nutrition and provides a choice of electives tailored to meet the varied professional needs of prospective students. Individuals will develop leadership skills and a thorough knowledge of research methods appropriate for their professional endeavors.

ProgramName: Master of Education in Administration and Supervision, Higher Education Specialization
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. The English proficiency requirement can be met by ONE of the following: An official TOEFL score of at least 525 (paper-based), 195 (computer-based), or 71 (Internet-based); An official IELTS score of at least 6.0; An official PTE score of at least 48; An official Duolingo score of at least 95; Proof of completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center; Proof of degree from an institution in a country where English is the official language.
Requirements: Admission to this program is competitive. Applicants should hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. In addition, prospective students must meet the following requirements: submission of an official transcript showing a minimum GPA of 2.75 for the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework; submission of an acceptable score on either the GRE (verbal and quantitative sections) or MAT. International students must also submit TOEFL scores.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Master of Education (M.Ed.) degree in Administration and Supervision is designed to prepare individuals for a wide variety of leadership positions in schools and school districts. The program has three concentrations for students to choose from. Those who already have a Tennessee teaching license can pursue the K-12 Administration concentration, leading to licensure as a school principal. The Agricultural Education Leadership concentration is designed for those who have a B.S. in an agricultural field. The Higher Education concentration is appropriate for those who wish to work in leadership positions at colleges or universities. The program has a 30-hour option, as well as a 33-hour option that includes a thesis. The Higher Education concentration prepares individuals who aspire to work in administrative and leadership positions in postsecondary settings, such as colleges and universities. No teaching license is required for this concentration.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable forms of proof include: A minimum score of 525 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT) or 71 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); A minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS; A minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; A minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; Completion of the ELS Language Centers' level 112.
Requirements:
Applicants must meet the following requirements for admission to the M.S.W. program.
Submit a graduate application with the application fee.
Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended to the College of Graduate Studies.
Have a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or a 3.0 in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Submit three letters of recommendation (at least one academic and one work/volunteer related).
Submit a professional résumé.
Submit a personal statement that addresses all of the prompts identified on the department website.
Complete an interview with a Social Work faculty member.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) is a professional degree designed to prepare students for advanced social work practice. The M.S.W. program's mission is to prepare social work professionals to enhance the well-being and quality of life for all persons, to promote social and economic justice, and to empower people, organizations, and communities through a generalist perspective and advanced clinical social work practice. The program also seeks to meet the needs of the mid-state region for professional social workers. The program focuses on clinical social work. Social work is a diverse and rewarding profession centered on a commitment to human dignity and social justice. Social workers are found in a variety of settings, such as social service agencies, schools, hospitals, courts, and correctional facilities. Social work involves both direct practice with individuals and families and work that is focused on policy and advocacy. The Department of Social Work offers the Master of Social Work degree.
Accredidation: The M.S.W. program at MTSU is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

EnglishScore: Official English proficiency scores are required of all applicants whose native language is not English. Accepted tests include TOEFL (iBT or PBT), IELTS, PTE Academic, Duolingo, and ELS Language Centers.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Concentration: Professional Mathematics, Mathematics Education, General Mathematics
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics offers a broad, in-depth study of mathematics, balancing theory and application. The program offers maximum flexibility for students, with a variety of course offerings and three concentrations: Professional Mathematics, Mathematics Education, and General Mathematics. The M.S. in Mathematics program is intended for a broad audience of students, including those in industry, government, research, community college teaching, and those preparing for Ph.D. work in the mathematical sciences. MTSU faculty are active in research in several areas, including mathematics education, data science and statistics, functional analysis and operator theory, graph theory, knot theory, and others. Faculty have a strong record of publications and grant activity and have won numerous awards for teaching excellence and research. Graduate students can expect individual attention and mentoring as well as opportunities for teaching assistantships with full tuition waivers. M.S. students have opportunities to work on research projects with faculty, often leading to presentations and publications.

ProgramName: Concentration in Mathematics - Pure and Applied Mathematics
EnglishScore: For international applicants, proficiency in English must be demonstrated prior to admission by submitting a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT, 550 on the TOEFL PBT, 6.0 on the IELTS, 53 on the PTE Academic, 100 on the Duolingo English test, or successful completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the M.S. in Mathematics program is determined by the mathematics graduate faculty and based on the applicant’s potential for success in the program. To be considered for admission, applicants must satisfy the minimum requirements of the College of Graduate Studies as well as the following departmental requirements:

An undergraduate major in mathematics or its equivalent from an accredited institution with a grade point average of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale.
A combined score of at least 291 (verbal plus quantitative) on the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) with a quantitative score of at least 146.
Three letters of recommendation from former professors that address the applicant’s potential for successfully completing a graduate program in mathematics.
A one-page statement of purpose explaining the applicant's background and motivation for pursuing a graduate degree in mathematics.

Students who do not satisfy all the above requirements may be admitted with conditional status.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics offers concentrations in General Mathematics and Pure and Applied Mathematics. Students may pursue this degree on a full- or part-time basis. Research areas of the faculty supporting this program include algebra, analysis, applied mathematics, combinatorics, computational mathematics, differential equations, graph theory, mathematics education, numerical analysis, statistics, and topology.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts vary; for example, guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $3,500 to $7,000 per year.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Computational and Data Science
EnglishScore: International applicants must have a minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based) or 213 (computer-based) or 79-80 (Internet-based) or a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, and provide an official transcript in the native language and a translated version in English.
Requirements: To be considered for unconditional admission, an applicant must have a Master’s degree in a STEM field from an accredited institution. Applicants must also have a cumulative graduate GPA of at least 3.00 on a 4.00 scale. Application materials include: a completed online application, official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities, a current curriculum vitae (CV), a Statement of Purpose, and three letters of recommendation. The GRE is not required.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Ph.D. in Computational and Data Science (CDS) is an interdisciplinary graduate program designed for students who want to use advanced computational methods to solve complex problems. The program has a strong emphasis on data science, high performance computing, and computational modeling. The objective of the program is to provide a comprehensive education in computational and data sciences that will prepare students for careers in academia, industry, and government. The curriculum is flexible and can be tailored to the individual student’s interests and career goals. Students in the program will have the opportunity to work with faculty from a variety of disciplines, including computer science, mathematics, statistics, biology, chemistry, physics, and engineering.

ProgramName: Doctor of Philosophy in Mathematics and Science Education
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English language proficiency. This can be met by a minimum TOEFL score of 525 (PBT) or 71 (iBT), a minimum IELTS overall band score of 6.0, a minimum PTE score of 53, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: In order to be considered for unconditional admission, applicants must have: 1. Submit a graduate application with the application fee. 2. Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities previously attended. 3. Possess a master’s degree from an accredited institution. 4. Have a minimum graduate grade point average (GPA) of 3.25 on a 4.0 scale. 5. Complete Graduate Record Examination (GRE) (all three parts) with preferred minimum scores of 146 on the Verbal section, 151 on the Quantitative section, and a 4.0 on the Analytical Writing section. GRE scores must be within five years of the date of application. 6. Submit two letters of recommendation. 7. Submit an acceptable scholarly writing sample which demonstrates appropriate writing proficiency, analytical skills, and potential for doctoral-level research and scholarship. 8. Submit a Statement of Purpose indicating research interests and goals.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Concentration: Biological Education, Chemical Education, Interdisciplinary Science Education, Mathematics Education
Description: The Mathematics and Science Education Ph.D. program prepares students for careers as leaders in P-12 mathematics and science education. The program focuses on developing expertise in research methodologies related to teaching and learning in mathematics and science. Coursework also focuses on curriculum development and reform, social and political issues surrounding education, equity and access in education, and the use of technology in mathematics and science education.

ProgramName: Concentration in Mathematics - Actuarial and Financial Mathematics
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing one of the following: TOEFL score of 71 (iBT) or 525 (paper-based), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE academic score of 54, Duolingo English Test score of 100, or completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the M.B.A. program is granted to those who show high promise of success in a graduate business program. Each applicant is judged on the basis of their GMAT or GRE score, undergraduate record, and personal achievements. Admission decisions are based on the total profile. Applicants for the M.B.A. program must hold a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. All applicants must submit scores from the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Examination (GRE). A waiver of the GMAT/GRE requirement is available for qualified applicants. The GMAT/GRE may be waived for admission under any one of the following criteria:

- An undergraduate GPA of 3.25 or higher from an AACSB-accredited business school.
- An undergraduate GPA of 3.5 or higher from a regionally accredited institution.
- A terminal degree (e.g., Ph.D., M.D., Ed.D., J.D., D.D.S., D.V.M.).
- A master’s or other graduate degree with a GPA of 3.25 or higher.
- A CPA or other professional certification with a passing score.
- Substantial and significant managerial work experience (typically five or more years of progressively responsible experience).
- Successful completion of at least 9 hours of graduate coursework from a regionally accredited college or university with a GPA of 3.5 or higher.

International applicants must submit a minimum TOEFL score of 550 (paper-based), 213 (computer-based), or 79-80 (Internet-based) or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5. A waiver of the English proficiency test requirement can be obtained by meeting one of the waiver conditions listed in the graduate catalog. Additional admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies must be met. See graduate catalog for additional details.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Concentration: ['Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI)', 'Finance', 'Healthcare Management', 'International Business', 'Management', 'Music Business', 'Supply Chain Management']
Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program provides a broad-based, cross-functional business education for individuals seeking careers in management in both the private and public sectors. The MBA curriculum at MTSU has been developed to include the functional areas of business within a framework that provides for analytical, data-driven decision-making and consideration of the contemporary business, professional, and ethical environment. The MBA program also encourages students to develop their creativity and innovative thinking. The MBA degree requires 36 semester hours of graduate course work, including an integrated, problem-solving capstone course in strategic management. This broad-based curriculum provides for a common body of knowledge while being flexible enough to allow students to choose a concentration from a variety of business fields.
Accredidation: The Jennings A. Jones College of Business is one of the 1.5% of business schools worldwide that is accredited in both business and accounting by AACSB International–The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the premier accrediting agency for business schools.

EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: a TOEFL score of 71 iBT, an IELTS score of 6.0, a PTE score of 54, a Duolingo score of 100, or an ELS level 112 certificate.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Business Administration (MBA) program is competitive. Applicants are evaluated on a number of factors, including academic background (GPA) and Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores. To be considered for admission, applicants should meet the criteria for regular or conditional admission. Regular Admission: GPA of 3.00 or higher and a GMAT score of 500 or higher (or equivalent GRE score). Conditional Admission: GPA of 2.75 to 2.99 and a GMAT score of 450-499 (or equivalent GRE score). A GMAT/GRE Waiver Request is available for applicants with a 3.50+ GPA or 5+ years of relevant professional/managerial experience.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The M.B.A. with a concentration in Marketing provides an opportunity for students to study contemporary marketing theory and practice in depth. Students in this program will learn how to design and deliver effective marketing campaigns, how to conduct and analyze market research, and how to make strategic decisions about pricing, product development, distribution, and promotion. The program is designed for students who want to pursue a career in marketing, as well as for those who are already working in marketing and want to advance their careers.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) and the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International. AACSB accreditation is the most prestigious and rigorous accreditation a business college can earn.

Requirements: Admission to the M.B.A. program at MTSU is competitive. To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies and additional requirements of the M.B.A. program. The MBA Admissions Committee considers each applicant’s potential for success in the M.B.A. program by reviewing undergraduate academic performance, GMAT or GRE scores (if required), and work experience. Requirements include: an earned bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college; an acceptable score on the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or the Graduate Record Examination (GRE). Applicants with an undergraduate GPA of 3.00 or above from an AACSB-accredited business school may request a GMAT/GRE waiver if they have at least two years of professional work experience. Also, those with an advanced degree (e.g., master’s or doctoral degree) may request a waiver. Applicants should also submit a current resume that shows evidence of at least two years of full-time work experience.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Healthcare Management concentration in the Jones College of Business M.B.A. program is a 36-hour program designed for individuals currently employed in or seeking employment in the healthcare industry. Courses are structured to explore current management issues and analyze and evaluate healthcare delivery systems. Students gain an understanding of the unique aspects of the healthcare industry and learn specialized business skills to become effective managers and leaders in the field. Admission to the M.B.A. program is required for those choosing this concentration.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, the premier accrediting agency for business schools.

ProgramName: Concentration in MBA - Strategic Marketing Analytics
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: 71 iBT (internet-based), 525 PBT (paper-based); IELTS: 6.0; PTE Academic: 54; Duolingo: 100; ELS: 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the MBA program, applicants must submit the following:

An online application with a nonrefundable application fee
Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities
A current résumé detailing work experience
GMAT/GRE scores (if applicable). See GMAT/GRE Waiver Policy below.

The GMAT/GRE is automatically waived if the applicant meets any of the following criteria:

Holds a terminal degree (e.g., Ph.D., M.D., Ed.D., J.D.)
OR
Holds a master's degree
OR
Has an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher from a regionally accredited institution
OR
Has a minimum of 5 years of professional work experience
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The strategic marketing analytics concentration prepares students for data-driven careers in marketing. Students in this concentration learn to become both analytical and creative marketing thinkers who can integrate technology with marketing strategy. Students develop skills in areas such as digital marketing, marketing research, and strategic marketing to become knowledgeable managers of information, technology, and marketing strategy. The strategic marketing analytics concentration positions graduates for data-driven careers such as digital marketing analyst, search engine marketing specialist, marketing researcher, social media marketer, and marketing data scientist.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for business schools.

ProgramName: Concentration in MBA - Legal and Ethical Governance
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT - 71, IELTS - 6.0, PTE academic - 54, Duolingo - 100, or successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies as well as the following M.B.A. program requirements:

1. A bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college.
2. Submission of an official GMAT or GRE score. The test requirement is waived if an applicant meets one of the following criteria:
    * An advanced degree (e.g., master's or doctoral) from an accredited institution
    * An undergraduate degree from an AACSB-accredited business school with a cumulative GPA of 3.25 or higher
    * Five years of professional/managerial work experience and an undergraduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
    * Membership in Beta Gamma Sigma
    * An undergraduate degree from MTSU with a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher
3. Submission of a current resume.
4. Submission of a statement of purpose (approximately 300 to 500 words) that outlines the applicant's reasons for pursuing the M.B.A., career goals, and any additional information that may be useful to the admissions committee.
5. International students must also meet the English proficiency requirements of the College of Graduate Studies.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) degree program is a general, broad-based degree designed to prepare its graduates for a variety of careers in management and leadership in either the private or public sector. The Jennings A. Jones College of Business provides a flexible program that serves both full-time students who have recently completed their undergraduate work as well as part-time students who are currently employed. The curriculum is designed to provide a broad foundation in the various functional areas of business and then allow the student to select an area of concentration in which to obtain more in-depth knowledge.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, the premier accrediting agency for business schools in the world.

EnglishScore: International applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met through a minimum score on the TOEFL (71 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (50), or Duolingo (100), or by completing Level 112 of the ELS Language Center's English for Academic Purposes Program. Certain applicants may be exempt.
Requirements:
Admission to the Master of Business Administration program is based on a combination of GMAT or GRE score and undergraduate GPA. Applicants should also submit a resume and statement of purpose. Applicants must have earned a four-year baccalaureate degree from an accredited university or college.

Admission standards are based on one of the following:

*   an admission index of 1050 (GPA x 200 + GMAT) or 1100 ([2.75 minimum] GPA x 200 + GMAT)
*   an admission index based on GRE scores that is comparable to the GMAT-based index

The GMAT/GRE will be waived for any applicant who has a 3.0 or higher undergraduate GPA from a regionally accredited institution OR who has an undergraduate degree from an AACSB-accredited business school. Applicants with five or more years of professional or military experience and a 2.75 or higher undergraduate GPA can request a GMAT/GRE waiver by completing the waiver request form.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: Students in the Risk Management and Insurance concentration within the Master of Business Administration program gain an understanding of risk management and insurance from the perspective of society, the insurer, and the policyholder. They acquire a basic knowledge of the role of personal and commercial property and liability insurance in risk management, as well as an understanding of the concepts of risk management, insurer operations and regulation, and key aspects of life and health insurance and related employee benefit plans. Students will be prepared for a wide variety of risk management and insurance industry positions.
Accredidation: AACSB

ProgramName: Concentration in MBA - Human Resource Management
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE Academic), Duolingo English Test, or proof of completion of ELS (English Language Services) Level 112.
Requirements:
MTSU offers two options for admission to the MBA program.

Option 1: GMAT or GRE Score Submission

Applicants should meet the following minimum requirements:
- A bachelor’s degree from a college or university accredited by the appropriate regional accrediting agency.
- A minimum of 2.75 undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale.
- Submission of GMAT or GRE scores.
- A score of at least 1000, based on the formula: 200 times the undergraduate GPA plus the total GMAT score (or GRE equivalent).
- A score of at least 450 on the GMAT (or GRE equivalent).

Option 2: GMAT or GRE Waiver

Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a college or university accredited by the appropriate regional accrediting agency AND meet at least ONE of the following criteria:
- A minimum of 3.25 undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale, OR
- An earned graduate degree (master’s, doctoral, or professional) from an accredited institution, OR
- Five years of progressive, professional, full-time work experience.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: This concentration prepares a manager to strategically manage human resources. It examines human resources from the viewpoint of a business partner and is ideal for those who are human resource managers, or who aspire to be, and for those who manage people. It provides the skills to create an environment that will result in a motivated and committed workforce. Required courses include Employment Law, Strategic Staffing, Compensation and Benefits, and an elective. All courses are SHRM-aligned.
Accredidation: AACSB Accredited

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); International English Language Testing System (IELTS); Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE); Duolingo; ELS Language Centers - Level 112; Proof of degree from a U.S. institution; Proof of citizenship from a country where English is the official language.
Requirements: The College of Graduate Studies requirements for full admission include submission of an application to the College of Graduate Studies, an official transcript from each college or university attended, and an official score on the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test. The minimum GMAT score accepted is 500 (with minimums of 25 on verbal and 28 on quantitative). A total GRE score of 1050 (302 on the revised scale with minimums of 150 on verbal and 152 on quantitative) is acceptable. Test scores submitted must not be more than five years old. In addition to the College of Graduate Studies requirements, applicants to the MBA program must submit the following directly to the MBA office: a current resume and a 150-word statement of purpose.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program provides a broad-based graduate business education for students from a variety of academic backgrounds. This professional degree program prepares individuals for responsible managerial positions in business, government, and nonprofit institutions. The program helps students develop and integrate a functional knowledge of marketing, management, finance, accounting, and economics. For those who can benefit from a more specialized program, four concentrations are available: music business, healthcare management, supply chain management, and data analytics. The Data Analytics concentration is an interdisciplinary course of study that combines business analytics, computer information systems, and economics and finance to prepare graduates to manage and utilize big data in a business setting.
Accredidation: AACSB-International

ProgramName: Concentration in MBA - IT Project Management
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting an official score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test (pBT) or 79 on the Internet-based test (iBT); the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.5; the Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 58; or Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 110. Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112 will also be accepted.
Requirements:
In addition to the admission requirements of the College of Graduate Studies, applicants must have:

* a bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college;
* an undergraduate GPA of 2.75 for admission.
    * Applicants with an undergraduate GPA below 2.75 but no lower than 2.25 may be considered for conditional admission. Please contact the MBA office for details.

Applicants must submit a current resume and official scores from the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or the Graduate Record Examination (GRE). See waiver policy below.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) program is a broad-based, general management degree designed to prepare students for executive and leadership positions. Leadership and management skills are developed through a core of courses that focus on the functional areas of business and the integration of these areas. Flexibility is provided through a concentration or electives. The Information Technology Project Management concentration focuses on managing and coordinating resources to complete information technology projects on time, within budget, and meeting user specifications. Topics include project integration, project scope management, project time and cost management, quality management, human resource management, communications management, risk management, and procurement management.
Accredidation: The Jones College is one of the top 1.5% of business schools in the world, having maintained its accreditation by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International for over 40 years.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by ONE of the following: TOEFL (71 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (54), Duolingo (100), or Completion of ELS Level 112. Having a degree from a U.S. institution or citizenship from certain English-speaking countries may waive this requirement.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Business Administration program is based upon the applicant’s potential to complete the program successfully. Each applicant is evaluated on a combination of factors including prior academic performance, test scores, work and/or leadership experience, and motivation to complete a rigorous graduate business program. Applicants who have a 3.00 undergraduate GPA from a regionally accredited institution are exempt from the GMAT/GRE requirement. Applicants who have a cumulative undergraduate GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 can be considered for admission to the MBA program if their GMAT score is at least 500 or their equivalent GRE score (calculated from the GRE Comparison Tool for Business Schools) plus their undergraduate GPA multiplied by 200 equals at least 1,100 ([GPA x 200] + GMAT/GRE equivalent ≥ 1,100). Applicants who have a cumulative undergraduate GPA lower than 2.75 can be considered for admission if their GMAT score is at least 500 or their equivalent GRE score (calculated from the GRE Comparison Tool for Business Schools) plus their undergraduate GPA multiplied by 200 equals at least 1,150 ([GPA x 200] + GMAT/GRE equivalent ≥ 1,150). The College of Graduate Studies requires a minimum GMAT score of 450 (or GRE equivalent) for all MBA applicants.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Music Business concentration offers specialized training for those desiring to work in the dynamic, international music industry. Students are challenged in a rigorous M.B.A. curriculum while taking advantage of the recording industry major in the College of Media and Entertainment. Classes are taught by full-time faculty and an extensive list of adjunct instructors with wide-ranging experience and accomplishments in all facets of the music business. Students gain hands-on experience by networking with and working for a broad range of music industry enterprises.
Accredidation: The Master of Business Administration program is accredited by AACSB International-The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, the premier accrediting agency for business school programs.

EnglishScore: English proficiency must be demonstrated by any one of the following: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 5.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; successful completion of ELS (English Language Services) Level 112; four years of study at a U.S. high school without ESL coursework; graduation from a secondary school in a native English-speaking country; or at least 24 semester hours of transferable credit from a U.S. college/university with a 2.00 GPA, including the equivalent of ENGL 1010 & 1020 with grades of 'C' or better.
Requirements: To be considered for admission in good standing, freshman applicants must have a high school diploma and meet ONE of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR a minimum 22 ACT composite (1020 SAT) and a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. Beginning with the Fall 2021 semester, MTSU will be test-optional for admissions. Freshman applicants who do not meet the 3.0 GPA requirement for guaranteed admission may still be admitted. MTSU will calculate a holistic score based on a combination of your GPA and any ACT/SAT test scores you submit.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree is offered through departments in the Colleges of Behavioral and Health Sciences, Liberal Arts, and Education. This degree requires a minimum of 120 semester hours. Each student must complete a major, General Education requirements, and the B.A. degree requirements which include 6 semester hours of foreign language. Consult the sections for the individual departments in this catalog for specific major requirements. For current degree plans, please click on the following link: Degree Plans.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL score of 500 (paper-based) or 61 (internet-based), IELTS score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo English Test score of 90, or Completion of ELS Language Center's Level 109.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit official high school transcripts. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is not required for admission consideration. For assured admission, a first-time freshman needs a 3.0+ high school GPA. Admission by holistic review is for students with a 2.70-2.99 high school GPA; these students may be asked to submit a personal statement to be reviewed by the admissions committee.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Department of Management offers majors in Management, Supply Chain Management, and Entrepreneurship. Our programs are designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in a wide range of careers.
CostPerCredit: $416/credit hour (In-State); $1,536/credit hour (Out-of-State), plus a $25/credit hour fee for business courses.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (71 iBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), or Duolingo (95). Other ways to meet the requirement include completion of the MTSU Intensive English Program (IEP), successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112, graduation from a high school in the United States, or completion of 24 transferable semester hours from an accredited U.S. college or university.
Requirements: Admission to the Art, B.F.A., Studio Art Concentration, requires formal application to the Department of Art and Design. This is a competitive entry program. Each spring semester, a faculty committee reviews portfolios of applicants currently enrolled in the Art B.A. or B.S. program (or transfer equivalent coursework) who have completed the Art and Design Core with a minimum 2.50 GPA and an overall GPA of 2.00.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts degree with a concentration in Studio provides a strong professional degree for those students who plan to pursue art as a career and/or continue their education at the graduate level. The B.F.A. is recognized as the professional degree for artists. The degree requires students to complete a strong core of general education, in addition to extensive study in areas such as drawing, painting, sculpture, ceramics, printmaking, photography, or graphic design. Students wishing to be considered for admission to the B.F.A. program must pass a portfolio review.
Accredidation: The Department of Art and Design is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to meet English proficiency requirements: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (pBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 5.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English test; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the School of Music requires both admission to Middle Tennessee State University and a successful audition on a primary instrument or voice. Auditions occur throughout the year before a faculty panel for entrance the following fall semester. For general university admission, MTSU has a test-optional policy for most applicants. For assured admission, applicants must have a 3.0 high school GPA or higher, or a 2.70-2.99 GPA and a 19 ACT composite (990 SAT) score.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) degree in Music, Instrumental Music Education Concentration, is designed for students who desire to teach instrumental music (band or orchestra) in public schools. This degree program prepares students for the rigorous demands of instrumental music education through a combination of applied music study, music theory, music history, and pedagogical methods specifically tailored for instrumental music. Graduates of this program will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to create a positive and effective learning environment for K-12 instrumental music students. The curriculum includes extensive practical experience through student teaching and participation in various instrumental ensembles. Upon successful completion of the program and passing appropriate licensure exams, graduates will be eligible for Tennessee teacher licensure in Instrumental Music (K-12).

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (minimum 500 PBT or 61 iBT), IELTS (minimum 5.5), PTE Academic (minimum 48), Duolingo English Test (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Language Center’s level 112. Other exemptions are also available.
Requirements: Students may select General Science as their major upon being admitted to MTSU.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Do you love science, but you’re not sure which specific scientific field you want to pursue? The B.S. in Science, General Science Concentration provides students with a broad scientific background by combining courses in biology, chemistry, geology, and physics. Students are given the flexibility to choose courses that best suit their interests and career goals. This program is suitable for students who wish to pursue a career in science or pursue additional degrees, such as an M.D. or an M.S. in science education. This program provides a solid foundation for those interested in a career in science. Graduates will be well-prepared to pursue employment in various scientific fields, including research, laboratory work, or science education. The flexibility of the General Science Concentration also allows students to prepare for professional programs like medical school, dental school, or pharmacy school.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $441/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,235/credit hour (based on 2023-2024 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,000 per year for guaranteed scholarships

EnglishScore: All international students must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted proofs include a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 71, TOEFL PBT score of 525, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 54, Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 112, among other options.
Requirements:
Admission to the MTSU School of Nursing is competitive. Meeting minimum criteria for admission does not guarantee admission to the program. All applicants must meet the following minimum requirements to be considered for admission:
1. Be admitted to MTSU. See Undergraduate Admissions for University admission criteria.
2. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. Completion of 45 semester hours to include the following courses with a grade of C or better: ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020, MATH 1710, BIOL 2010/2011, BIOL 2020/2021, CHEM 1030/1031 (or higher level chemistry), and PSY 1410. Courses cannot be in progress at time of application.
4. A satisfactory score on a nursing admission test specified by the School of Nursing. HESI A2 is the current admission test. Information on the required sections of the test, how to register and test dates will be provided at information sessions and will be posted on the School of Nursing website. There must be a minimum of 6 months between testing dates if the student is repeating the admission test. Scores are good for one calendar year.
5. Submission of the School of Nursing application with all required documentation by the posted deadline.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) program prepares graduates for entry into professional nursing practice and provides the foundation for graduate study. Graduates are prepared as generalists to deliver patient-centered care and function as members of an interdisciplinary health care team, utilizing evidence-based practice, quality improvement, and informatics. Graduates are prepared for leadership roles, professional growth and development, and health care policy. The B.S.N. is a pre-licensure degree program.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Acceptable tests include TOEFL (minimum 71 iBT/525 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum 48), Duolingo (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Social Work program is separate from admission to the university. Students must apply to the university as pre-social work majors and then apply to the Social Work program after completing 45 hours of coursework. Admission to the program is competitive. To apply, a student must have: completed a minimum of 45 semester hours of coursework; a minimum overall GPA of 2.25; completed SW 2110 with a grade of C or better; submitted the Social Work Program Application for Admission (including a personal essay); successfully completed an admission interview with Social Work faculty; and completed SOWK 2110, ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020, and COMM 2200.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) program at Middle Tennessee State University is committed to preparing students for competent generalist social work practice, graduate studies in social work, and lifelong learning. The B.S.W. program is a generalist social work program designed to provide students with the knowledge, values, and skills necessary for entry-level professional social work practice in a wide variety of settings. The program also prepares students for graduate social work education. The overall mission of the B.S.W. program is to prepare students to be ethical and competent generalist social work practitioners who are committed to social and economic justice and human rights for diverse populations. Students will develop and apply knowledge, values, and skills to empower individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities through effective interventions, policy analysis, advocacy, and research.
Accredidation: The Middle Tennessee State University Bachelor of Social Work Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by achieving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL iBT score of 61, TOEFL paper-based test score of 500, IELTS overall band score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, Michigan English Test (MET) score of 53, or International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) score of 3.6. Completion of level 109 of the ELS Language Centers program also fulfills this requirement. Waivers are available under certain conditions.
Requirements: First-time freshmen who meet the following criteria will be granted full admission to the University: Graduated from high school or successfully completed the GED, HiSet, or TASC, and Submitted a qualifying test score (22 ACT or 1100 SAT or a 3.0 High School GPA), and Completed the 16-course college preparatory curriculum.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Are you ready for a high-flying career? As a major aerospace hub, Middle Tennessee State University has become a premier choice for students aspiring to work in the aerospace industry. From flight and air traffic control to maintenance and administration, MTSU prepares students for a variety of aerospace careers. The Maintenance Management concentration is designed for students interested in the airline or general aviation maintenance industry or in aerospace manufacturing and repair. The program includes hands-on experience in the classroom and hangar settings at the MTSU Aerospace campus and internships and co-ops with industry partners. Graduates of the program are prepared for careers in a rapidly growing industry, including: Aircraft Maintenance and Repair, Maintenance Management, Quality Control/Assurance, Aircraft Manufacturing, Avionics Technician.
