Accredidation: The B.S. in Aerospace degree, with concentrations in Flight, Air Traffic Control, Aerospace Technology, and Maintenance Management, is housed in the Department of Aerospace, which is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

EnglishScore: For international applicants from non-English speaking countries, demonstration of English proficiency is required. This can be met by submitting a minimum score from one of the following tests: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (45), Duolingo (85), or by successfully completing ELS Language Center's Level 112, among other options.
Requirements: An applicant for admission as a freshman must be a graduate of an accredited high school with a regular diploma and have a minimum high school GPA of 3.0. Applicants who do not meet the 3.0 GPA minimum may be admitted with a 2.7 GPA and an 18 ACT (960 SAT).
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: MTSU's Animation program trains students in the art and craft of creating animated films and interactive experiences. Students gain broad exposure to all aspects of the animation pipeline, from story and design to modeling, animation, lighting, texturing, rigging, compositing, and rendering. We emphasize a hands-on approach to learning in a studio-like environment. Small classes and dedicated faculty ensure that students receive individual attention and feedback on their projects. The Animation curriculum prepares students for a career in various areas of the animation industry, including 2D animation, 3D animation, motion graphics, visual effects, and game development. Animation program graduates can pursue careers in a wide range of industries including film, television, video games, advertising, and education. Possible job titles include: 2D Animator, 3D Animator, Motion Graphics Designer, Visual Effects Artist, Technical Artist, Storyboard Artist, Character Designer, Concept Artist, Rigger, Texture Artist, Lighting Artist, Render Wrangler.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by providing an official score report from one of the following exams. All scores must be less than two years old.
Requirements: Admission to the Audio Production program is highly competitive and is based on a review of student academic records after the completion of a set of lower-division prerequisite courses at MTSU.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: As one of the world's premier programs in audio engineering and music production, the Audio Production program prepares students for careers in the audio arts. Housed in the College of Media and Entertainment, the program is unique in its integration of the artistic and scientific elements of audio, with courses ranging from electronic music and critical listening to the physics of sound and advanced digital audio workstation operation. Graduates work as engineers, producers, and technicians in recording studios, live sound venues, broadcast facilities, and other media operations. The Audio Production program provides students with a solid academic foundation and the practical skills needed to be successful in the professional audio world. Core courses focus on topics such as acoustics, critical listening, studio recording techniques, mixing, mastering, and the business of audio. A wide range of electives are available for students to specialize in areas such as live sound, post-production audio for film and video, game audio, electronic music production, and broadcast audio.

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants can demonstrate English proficiency through various means, including a minimum TOEFL score of 61 (iBT) or 500 (PBT), a minimum IELTS overall band score of 5.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109. Exemptions are available for students from certain English-speaking countries or those who have completed specific English coursework.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, prospective freshmen must submit a completed application, a nonrefundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. For students who choose to submit test scores with their application, admission will be granted based on the following: Regular Admission: 22 ACT or 1100 SAT and 3.0 GPA. For students who choose to apply without test scores (Test-Optional), admission will be granted based on the following: Test-Optional Admission: 3.5 GPA.
Department: School of Concrete and Construction Management
Description: The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at MTSU is a four-year bachelor of science degree program that began in 1996 to address the need for a management-oriented program specifically designed for the concrete industry. The CIM program has been extremely successful because of the unique partnership between the university, industry, and the patron organizations. The curriculum addresses all aspects of the concrete industry and prepares graduates for careers in management, sales, marketing, production, and quality control. Graduates are in high demand across the United States. Many receive multiple offers from top concrete companies.

EnglishScore: All undergraduate international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (50), Duolingo English Test (95), or ELS Language Centers (Level 112).
Requirements:
Assured admission will be granted to students who meet one of the following criteria:
- 3.0 GPA or higher
- 2.7 GPA and an ACT composite score of 20 (or SAT of 1020) or higher
- ACT composite score of 22 (or SAT of 1100) or higher
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Concentration: Science and Technology, Business and Entrepreneurship
Description: Fermentation Science is an interdisciplinary program that draws from the fields of biology, chemistry, and microbiology, along with business and agriculture. Through classroom study and hands-on experiences, students will learn to apply scientific principles to the controlled growth and activity of microorganisms to produce fermented products. Students will develop skills in the areas of analytical chemistry, microbiology, sensory evaluation, and process control. MTSU’s Fermentation Science Program is unique in its breadth, encompassing beer, wine, spirits, foods, and industrial fermentation, and in its blend of technical and business courses. Students completing the Fermentation Science program will be prepared to enter the workforce in a variety of fermentation industries including brewing, distilling, winemaking, food, and industrial applications. Students can also prepare for graduate school or professional school programs.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT score of 71 (or 525 PBT), IELTS overall band score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 53, Duolingo English Test score of 100, or completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.
Department: School of Agriculture

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all applicants whose native language is not English. This can be shown by meeting ONE of the following: Minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT), Minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based TOEFL (iBT), Minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS, Minimum score of 85 on the Duolingo English Test, Minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic, Completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Admission to the Mechatronics Engineering program requires a minimum ACT Mathematics subscore of 22 (or SAT equivalent) and a high school GPA of 3.0. Students not meeting this standard will be admitted to the Pre-Mechatronics Engineering program.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Middle Tennessee State University's Mechatronics Engineering Bachelor of Science degree is the first of its kind in Tennessee. Mechatronics combines mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, and control engineering, resulting in a synergistic system that integrates these fields. As automation and smart technologies rapidly become the norm across industries, Mechatronics Engineering plays a vital role in designing, implementing, and maintaining them. Our program emphasizes hands-on learning, design projects, and industry partnerships to provide students with practical skills and real-world experience. With a Mechatronics Engineering degree from MTSU, you'll be at the forefront of innovation. You will learn to design, build, and maintain intelligent systems, robots, and automated processes. This interdisciplinary field opens doors to diverse career paths in manufacturing, aerospace, automotive, healthcare, and more. Our graduates are well-prepared to tackle complex challenges and contribute to technological advancements. Core areas of study include: Mechanical Systems, Electrical Systems, Control Systems, Computer Programming, Robotics, Automation.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology degree with a concentration in Mechatronics Engineering is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, B.S. (Commercial Songwriting | Music Business)
EnglishScore: MTSU requires proof of English proficiency for all international applicants whose native language is not English. Any one of the following is acceptable: TOEFL score of at least 525 (paper-based) or 71 (internet-based), IELTS score of at least 6.0, PTE score of at least 48, Duolingo English Test score of at least 95, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To be admitted to the university, prospective freshmen must meet one of the following criteria for assured admission: 3.0 GPA, or 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020), or 2.5 GPA and an ACT score of 22 (or SAT of 1100). After being admitted to MTSU, students seeking to major in Recording Industry must apply for candidacy in a specific concentration. For the Music Business concentration, a resume and a statement of goals are required. For the Commercial Songwriting concentration, a portfolio of two original songs (audio recording and lyric sheet) and a statement of goals are required.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: MTSU's Department of Recording Industry, founded in 1973, is recognized as one of the oldest and most respected programs globally and is consistently ranked among the nation's top music business schools by Billboard. Housed in the university’s College of Media and Entertainment, the department offers students a hands-on, professionally oriented curriculum. It provides state-of-the-art facilities, including seven recording studios, two mixing labs, a mastering lab, and a new live sound studio. Students also have opportunities for internships and other experiential learning activities. The faculty includes Grammy-nominated engineers, producers, and songwriters. Alumni have a strong record of success, routinely working on Grammy- and Dove Award-winning projects, with several inducted into the TEC Awards Hall of Fame.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $372/Credit Hour; Out-of-State: $1,104/Credit Hour (based on 2024-2025 rates)

ProgramName: Video & Film Production, B.S. (Live Production and Filmmaking concentrations)
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. MTSU accepts several methods of proof. One method is through test scores: TOEFL: 500 PBT or 61 IBT, IELTS: 5.5, PTE Academic: 48, Duolingo: 90, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Video and Film Production major is not competitive. Any student admitted to MTSU may declare a major in Video and Film Production. General university admission requirements for freshmen include one of the following paths: Earn a 3.0 high school GPA (test-optional), OR earn a 2.7 high school GPA AND an ACT score of 21 or an SAT score of 1060, OR meet GPA and test score combinations on a sliding scale.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: The Video & Film Production program at Middle Tennessee State University has been preparing students for careers in the television and film industries for more than 40 years. Our graduates are equipped with technical and aesthetic skills to create visual stories and produce a wide array of content for broadcast, cable, streaming services, and the big screen. You'll gain a strong foundation in visual storytelling, critical analysis, aesthetic development, professional ethics, and research and writing. The curriculum also provides experience in all aspects of production from concept to distribution, including camera operation, lighting, sound recording, editing, and post-production. You'll choose one of two concentrations: Live Production, which trains students to work in multi-camera studio and remote environments; or Filmmaking, which prepares students for careers in single-camera production environments like narrative and documentary film. Both concentrations emphasize collaboration and hands-on learning with industry-standard equipment and facilities.

ProgramName: Aerospace B.S. (Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Technology only)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL with a minimum score of 525 (PBT) or 71 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 6.0, PTE Academic with a minimum score of 54, Duolingo with a minimum score of 105, or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
Admission to the university is a separate procedure from admission to the Aerospace Department. For university admission, to be considered for guaranteed admission, applicants must have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite score of 22 (or 1100 SAT total score) AND meet High School Core requirements. For regular admission, applicants must have a minimum ACT composite of 20 (or 1020 SAT total score) AND a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. MTSU is test-optional for students who have a 3.0 high school GPA.

Formal admission to the Aerospace Department is an additional process. All students enter the university as Pre-Aerospace majors and must meet specific requirements to be admitted into one of the six concentrations. Admission to an Aerospace concentration is limited to students who have completed at least 15 semester hours of college-level work, earned an overall minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.50, and earned a grade of 'C' or better in AERO 1010 and AERO 1020.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Concentration: Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Aerospace Technology
Description: MTSU's Aerospace Department is the largest and most comprehensive university-level aviation program in Tennessee and one of the largest in the nation. It boasts a diverse fleet of aircraft, state-of-the-art simulators, and dedicated faculty, offering a rich educational experience for aspiring aviation professionals. The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace prepares students for a variety of aviation careers. Depending on the chosen concentration, graduates can pursue roles as professional pilots, aviation managers, flight dispatchers, maintenance managers, aerospace technologists, or unmanned aircraft systems operators. Graduates are highly sought after by airlines, corporate flight departments, fixed-base operators, government agencies, and other aviation-related businesses.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI), ensuring high standards of education and industry relevance.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met through various means, including minimum scores on tests such as TOEFL (71 iBT / 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), or Duolingo (100).
Requirements:
The I/O Psychology major is an upper-division major. This means that students must be admitted to the major before they are able to enroll in our upper division major courses (PSY 3020, PSY 4260, PSY 4280, PSY 4290, PSY 4770, and PSY 4900). To be considered for admission to the I/O Psychology major, students must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Completion of at least 30 credit hours.
2. An overall GPA of 3.0 or better.
3. Completion of PSY 1410 with a grade of B- or better.
4. Completion of PSY 2020 or an equivalent course with a grade of C or better.
5. An average GPA of 3.0 or better for all psychology (PSY) courses.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: Industrial-Organizational (I-O) Psychology is the scientific study of working and the application of that science to workplace issues facing individuals, teams, and organizations. The I-O major at MTSU prepares students with the knowledge and skills needed for successful careers in a variety of fields (human resources, talent acquisition, training and development, organizational development, etc.) or for graduate studies in I-O psychology, human resources, or other related disciplines. The B.S. in I-O Psychology provides students with foundational knowledge about human behavior at work with a focus on psychological principles and research methods. You’ll learn how to apply psychological principles to help organizations improve productivity, employee satisfaction, and overall effectiveness. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, data analysis, and problem-solving skills, preparing you for a wide range of careers or further education in the field.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate international students must demonstrate English proficiency through one of several options, including: TOEFL iBT score of 61, TOEFL PBT score of 500, IELTS score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo English Test score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Jones College of Business is required. For full admission to the Jones College of Business, students must have a 2.50 overall GPA and have completed certain lower-division business courses.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: Supply chain management is the management of the flow of goods and services and includes all processes that transform raw materials into final products. It involves the active streamlining of a business's supply-side activities to maximize customer value and gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace. Supply chain management involves a company's efforts to develop and implement supply chains that are as efficient and economical as possible. The Supply Chain Management program at MTSU focuses on sourcing, production, and distribution management, with particular emphasis on logistics and transportation. Students completing this degree will be prepared for a wide variety of supply chain and logistics careers in manufacturing, retail, transportation, and health care industries.
Accredidation: The Jennings A. Jones College of Business is proud to be accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This accreditation represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide. Less than 5% of the world's 16,000 business programs have earned AACSB accreditation.

EnglishScore: All applicants from non-native English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following minimum scores: TOEFL PBT 500, TOEFL iBT 61, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 45, Duolingo English Test 85, or by completing ELS Language Center's level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Media Management, B.S. program is based on general undergraduate admission to Middle Tennessee State University. According to the MTSU Undergraduate Catalog, 'Any student may be a Media Management major.' General freshman admission requirements are based on high school GPA and/or ACT/SAT scores. For Fall 2024 and 2025 terms, MTSU is test-optional, allowing admission for students with a 3.0 high school GPA without a test score. For students who submit scores, guaranteed admission includes criteria such as a 3.5+ high school GPA, or a 3.0+ GPA combined with a minimum 22 ACT composite or 1100 SAT total score.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Fees: In-State: $9,770/year; Out-of-State: $30,458/year (2023-24 rates including mandatory fees)
Concentration: Live Production, Media Sales, Sports Media
Description: The Media Management program prepares students for a variety of careers in the converging media industries. Students study leadership, management, economics, and law as they apply to radio, television, motion pictures, music, news, and digital media industries. The curriculum provides a balance between theoretical and practical application and includes a robust internship program. Our graduates are prepared to contribute to the financial health and creative success of media organizations throughout the world. The Media Management program offers three concentrations: live production, media sales, and sports media.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $324/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,186/credit hour (2023-24 tuition only)
ScholarshipAmount: $3,000 - $5,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

ProgramName: Aerospace B.S. (Flight Dispatch, Unmanned Aircraft Systems only)
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official score report from one of the following testing agencies: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, or ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
Admission to MTSU is required for this program. Once admitted, students can declare a major in Aerospace with a concentration in Flight Dispatch or Unmanned Aircraft Systems. General freshman admission to MTSU is test-optional and based on high school GPA.

Assured Admission criteria:
- 3.0 GPA or higher
- OR 2.99-2.5 GPA AND an ACT composite of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent)
- OR 2.49 GPA or lower AND an ACT composite of 24 or higher (or SAT equivalent)

Applicants who do not meet the assured admission requirements will have their application reviewed holistically.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by submitting official scores from one of the following: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo. Completion of ELS Language Center Level 112 or successful completion of a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. institution or from a country where English is the official language may also be accepted.
Requirements: Admission to the Engineering Technology program requires that students meet the University's general admission requirements.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering Technology with an Electromechanical Concentration focuses on applying principles of electricity, electronics, and mechanics to design, develop, and test electromechanical systems. With state-of-the-art facilities and experienced faculty, students gain hands-on experience in areas such as robotics, automation, and control systems. The program prepares graduates for careers in industries such as manufacturing, aerospace, and defense, where they will be responsible for designing, testing, and maintaining complex electromechanical systems.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $2,000 to $6,000 per year.

EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL score of 500 (paper-based) or 61 (internet-based), IELTS score of 5.5, PTE score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, Completion of the ELS Language Center's Level 112, or meeting other academic criteria from a US institution or being from a country where English is the official language.
Requirements: No special admission requirements for this program. Admission is based on general university admission standards. For freshmen, MTSU will guarantee admission to first-time freshmen who have a 3.0 GPA or higher OR an ACT composite of 22 (or 1100 SAT) or higher. Students who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements will have their application reviewed holistically. Several factors are considered in the holistic review process, including but not limited to, high school GPA, ACT/SAT scores, dual enrollment coursework, the rigor of high school curriculum, and student involvement. High School Curriculum requirements: 14 units are required for regular admission including: 4 units of English; 3 units of Math (including Algebra I & II, Geometry); 3 units of science (including Biology I, Chemistry I or Physics); 1 unit of U.S. History; 1 unit of world history or world geography; 2 units of the same foreign language; and 1 unit of visual or performing arts.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Environmental science is an interdisciplinary field that integrates physical, biological, and information sciences to study the environment, and the solution of environmental problems. It is a broad field of study that includes a wide range of disciplines. Students who study environmental science learn how to identify, evaluate, and solve environmental problems; how to prevent future environmental problems; and how to manage and conserve natural resources. Students also learn how to communicate scientific information to a variety of audiences, including policymakers and the public. With a degree in environmental science, you can pursue careers in government agencies, non-profit organizations, and private industry, working to protect and improve the environment.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 71, IELTS 6.0, PTE Academic 54, or Duolingo English Test 100. Completion of ELS Level 112 also meets this requirement. Exemptions are available for students from certain English-speaking countries or educational backgrounds.
Requirements: To be admitted to the university, students must meet assured admission requirements. For students who do not meet assured admission, a holistic review of their application will be considered. Due to the ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, MTSU will be test-optional for students applying for admission through fall 2025.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: MTSU's Forensic Science B.S. degree is designed for students seeking careers in forensic science or wishing to continue their education in graduate or professional programs in forensic science, medicine, chemistry, or molecular biology. The curriculum includes courses from Forensic Science, Biology, Chemistry, Mathematics, Criminal Justice, and Psychology. The program has concentrations in Forensic Chemistry and Forensic Biology. The Forensic Science curriculum is focused on the application of scientific principles and techniques for the purpose of justice. The program offers hands-on experience through labs and research opportunities, including an optional internship. Students in the program develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills necessary for success in forensic science and related fields. In addition, students have the opportunity to work alongside faculty on research projects and participate in student organizations related to forensic science.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English. This may be met by submitting one of the following: TOEFL score of 71 (iBT) or 525 (PBT); IELTS score of 6.0; PTE Academic score of 48; Duolingo English Test score of 95; Certificate of Completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: In addition to meeting the University's admission requirements, all students intending to major in music must audition for acceptance into the School of Music as a major. Auditions are held on several dates during the spring semester for students who intend to enter the University in the fall. An audition can be scheduled for students who cannot attend on one of the specified dates. For information concerning the audition, contact the director of the School of Music. Students who do not perform a successful audition may be admitted to the University as pre-music majors, but they may not take applied music courses for credit toward a degree or major in any ensemble until they have successfully passed an audition.
Department: School of Music, College of Liberal Arts
Fees: In-State: $9,824/year; Out-of-State: $28,808/year (based on 2023-2024 full-time rates for 12+ credit hours per semester)
Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a Music Industry Concentration is the choice for students desiring a career in the professional music world with an emphasis on the business and technical aspects of music. This program combines professional-level musical training with courses in music business, recording industry, and other business areas. Students pursuing this concentration should have a solid musical background on an instrument or voice and a desire to learn about the inner workings of the music industry. Admission to the School of Music and a successful audition on an instrument or voice are required before students can be accepted into this concentration. Upon graduation, students are prepared for careers as artist managers, booking agents, promoters, copyright administrators, music publishers, record label executives, and similar positions.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $410/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1034/credit hour (based on 2023-2024 rates)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $9,824/year; Out-of-State: $28,808/year (based on 2023-2024 full-time rates for 12+ credit hours per semester)

ProgramName: Textiles Merchandising and Design (Fashion Merchandising and Apparel Design)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 71 on the internet-based test (iBT) for the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum overall band score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English test; or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Guaranteed admission will be granted to students with a 3.0 high school GPA or greater. Guaranteed admission will also be granted to students with an ACT composite score of 22 or an SAT score of 1100 (ERW+M) and a 2.7 high school GPA. First-time freshmen who are U.S. citizens or eligible non-citizens graduating from a U.S. high school with at least a 3.0 high school GPA may apply for test-optional admission.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: A Bachelor of Science degree in Textiles Merchandising and Design prepares students for careers in the fashion, textile, and apparel industries. There are two concentrations: Apparel Design and Fashion Merchandising. The Apparel Design concentration provides a broad-based knowledge of apparel design development, illustration, and construction, including computer-aided design, technical design, product development, and creative problem-solving. The Fashion Merchandising concentration provides knowledge in the functional areas of the textile, apparel, and home furnishings industries, including sourcing, product development, global marketing, supply chain management, retailing, visual merchandising, and entrepreneurship. Students majoring in Textiles Merchandising and Design are required to complete an internship. The department provides students with a variety of opportunities to become involved in extracurricular activities and organizations such as student fashion shows, career trips, and the Textile and Merchandising Society.

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English language proficiency. Accepted options and minimum scores include: TOEFL 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, Duolingo English Test 95, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following: Regular admission: 3.0 GPA or higher. Conditional admission: minimum 2.7 GPA and completion of the core high school courses. If you do not meet regular or conditional admission requirements, you may be eligible for admission through a holistic review. MTSU is a test-optional university. Applicants may submit ACT/SAT test scores, but they are not required for admission consideration.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: Our Interior Architecture (B.S.) is an FIDER/CIDA-accredited professional program that prepares graduates for entry-level positions in the interior design profession and for further study at the graduate level. The curriculum covers the knowledge and skills necessary to produce safe, functional, and aesthetically pleasing interior environments that meet the human need for shelter and well-being. The curriculum is developed to meet the standards of the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) and the National Architectural Accrediting Board (NAAB), preparing students for a variety of career options, including residential and commercial interior design, space planning, facilities management, and furniture design.
Accredidation: FIDER/CIDA-accredited professional program; curriculum developed to meet the standards of the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA) and the National Architectural Accrediting Board (NAAB).

EnglishScore: All students from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate proficiency in English. This requirement can be satisfied by submitting one of the following: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); a minimum IELTS score of 5.5; a minimum PTE Academic score of 43; a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95; completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements:
To be admitted to the Jones College of Business, students must
1. Have a minimum of 30 semester hours earned.
2. Have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA.
3. Complete the following courses with a grade of C or better: ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020; MATH 1630, MATH 1810 or MATH 1910; COMM 2200.
4. Complete the following courses with an average GPA of 2.25 or higher and a grade of C or better: ACCT 2110, ACCT 2120; ECON 2410, ECON 2420; INFS 2400 (or QM 2610).
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The accounting major prepares students for a variety of careers in both public and private accounting, as well as for graduate study. Accountants perform numerous financial activities including auditing, preparing income tax returns, developing and administering accounting information systems, and managing and controlling financial data for organizations. MTSU's Department of Accounting provides a state-of-the-art curriculum, excellent professors with diverse backgrounds and experiences, and many opportunities to engage with professionals in accounting through an active Beta Alpha Psi chapter and other professional organizations. The Professional Accountancy program allows students to complete both a BBA and Master of Science in Accounting (M.Acc.) in five years and meets the 150-hour requirement for CPA licensure.
Accredidation: The MTSU Jones College of Business and its Accounting Department are accredited by AACSB International.

EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency is required. Options listed on the university's international admissions page include a minimum TOEFL score of 71 (iBT) or 525 (PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE score of 53, a minimum Duolingo score of 100, or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit the following: An application for admission, a $25 nonrefundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Regular admission is granted to students who have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite of 22 or higher OR an SAT total of 1100 or higher. Middle Tennessee State University is a test-optional institution. You can choose whether to have your ACT or SAT scores included in your admissions review.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Actuarial science involves the application of mathematical and statistical methods to assess risk in insurance, finance and other industries and professions. Actuaries are problem solvers and strategic thinkers with a deep understanding of financial security systems, their design and their operation. They use quantitative skills to analyze data to estimate the probability and likely cost of future events. The Bachelor of Science in Actuarial Science degree program at UT Dallas provides comprehensive training in the fundamental mathematics, statistics and financial theory required for success in the actuarial profession. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for the Actuarial Society's professional examinations and to equip them with the analytical skills needed for successful careers.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT). IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 5.5. PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 59. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95. Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: For assured admission, freshmen must meet one of the following criteria: Option 1: 3.0 GPA, Option 2: 2.7 GPA and 21 ACT / 1060 SAT, Option 3: Less than 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT / 1100 SAT. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements may be reviewed for holistic admission. All students seeking admission must have completed the required high school units: 4 English; 3 Math (including Algebra I, II, Geometry); 3 Natural/Physical Science (including 1 Biology and 1 Chemistry); 1 Social Science/History; 1 U.S. History; and 2 in the same Foreign Language or Fine Art.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Aviation Management Concentration is for students who want to develop management and operations expertise in the aviation and aerospace industries. With a strong business and aviation focus, the Aviation Management program prepares students for leadership roles in various sectors of the aviation industry, including airport management, airline operations, air cargo, and fixed-base operations (FBOs).
Accredidation: The Aerospace program is separately accredited by Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or completion of ELS Level 112. Exemptions are available for students from certain English-speaking countries or those who have completed specific English-language coursework.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-time freshmen must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.7. Meeting this minimum requirement does not guarantee admission. Assured Admission is granted to students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher, or a high school GPA of 2.7 with an ACT score of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent). Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through a holistic review.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Aerospace with a concentration in Flight Dispatch is designed to prepare students for careers as aircraft dispatchers. Flight dispatchers are an integral part of an airline’s operations and, along with the pilot, are legally responsible for the safety of each flight. The dispatcher analyzes weather conditions, evaluates aircraft performance, computes the amount of fuel needed for each flight, determines the safest and most economical flight plan, and ensures that all aspects of a flight operation comply with FAA regulations. The dispatcher remains in contact with the flight crew throughout the flight to provide updated weather information and make any necessary changes to the flight plan. They also assist the flight crew in emergency situations. The program includes the academic training required to take the FAA Aircraft Dispatcher written and practical exams. Upon successful completion of these exams, students are issued an Aircraft Dispatcher Certificate. This certificate is required to work as an airline dispatcher.
Accredidation: The Aerospace Department is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by providing a minimum score from one of the following: TOEFL iBT (71), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (53), or Duolingo English Test (100). Completion of ELS Language Center Level 112 is also accepted. Other conditions and exemptions may apply.
Requirements: To be considered for admission as a first-time freshman, a student must present a transcript of credits from an accredited high school showing graduation and the date of graduation. Assured admission is granted to students with a 3.0 GPA or higher, or a 2.7 GPA or higher combined with an ACT composite of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be considered for admission based on a holistic review.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Fees: In-state: $4,984/semester; Out-of-state: $13,600/semester. Additional lab fees of approx. $20 per lab hour apply.
Description: This program offers a B.S. degree in Aerospace with a concentration in Maintenance Management. The Maintenance Management concentration is designed for individuals who desire a four-year degree with significant emphasis on aviation maintenance principles and practices coupled with critical management skills. This curriculum provides the academic coursework necessary to prepare students for leadership and management positions within the aviation industry. Students who successfully complete the required coursework and pass the FAA Airframe and Powerplant examinations are eligible for consideration for the optional 30 hours of academic credit through credit by exam.
Accredidation: The Department of Aerospace is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
CostPerCredit: In-state: $324/credit hour (tuition only); Out-of-state: $1,042/credit hour (tuition only).
CollegeApplicationFee: In-state: $4,984/semester; Out-of-state: $13,600/semester. Additional lab fees of approx. $20 per lab hour apply.
ScholarshipAmount: $2,000 to $5,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency.
Requirements: To declare a major in the Department of Aerospace, students must meet the Guaranteed Admission Standards for the University. For regular admission for students graduating high school in Spring 2021 and after, the requirements are: Completion of the secondary school Core unit requirements AND a minimum 3.0 high school GPA OR a minimum 2.7 high school GPA AND a minimum 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite. MTSU is currently test-optional for students applying through Fall 2025; students who have a 3.0 GPA or higher are not required to submit a test score for an admission decision.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Fees: In-state: $9,612/year; Out-of-state: $29,916/year (2023-2024 rates, does not include flight fees)
Description: The Professional Pilot Concentration is a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree program that provides students with the academic and flight training required to become professional pilots. It is an FAA Part 141 approved program that offers students the ability to earn multiple FAA certificates and ratings to include: Private Pilot Certificate, Instrument Rating, Commercial Pilot Certificate (single and multi-engine), and Certificated Flight Instructor (CFI). Successful graduates of the program are eligible for the FAA Restricted-ATP (R-ATP) certificate with 1,000 hours flight time.
Accredidation: FAA Part 141 approved program

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you will need: A completed undergraduate application for admission; Payment of the non-refundable application fee; An official high school transcript; Official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional for most applicants). Assured Admission criteria are a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher OR a high school GPA of 2.7 and an ACT score of 22 or an SAT score of 1100. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a combination of high school GPA and test scores, plus other information you wish to provide such as a recommendation from a school counselor or an essay.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: MTSU's Aerospace Technology concentration focuses on preparing students for careers in the aerospace industry that require knowledge of maintenance, manufacturing, and general technical applications. The curriculum emphasizes the application of scientific and technological knowledge related to the aerospace environment. Graduates are prepared for a variety of roles within the aerospace industry including technical management, quality assurance, research and development, and production.

ProgramName: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Undergraduate students are required to show proof of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL: 500 paper-based (PBT), 61 internet-based (iBT); IELTS: 5.5; PTE Academic: 48; Duolingo English Test: 85; ELS: Completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is based on a review of a student's academic achievements and potential for success. The university uses a 4.0 grading scale. In addition to the application for admission, students must submit a non-refundable application fee, official high school transcripts, and ACT or SAT scores. Some students may need to provide additional information.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Aerospace, B.S. with a concentration in Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations provides students with the academic foundation to pursue a wide range of career opportunities within the UAS industry, including flight operations, data analysis, payload operations, and business management. Students learn about the fundamental principles of UAS flight, navigation, and control, as well as the regulatory framework surrounding UAS operations. The curriculum emphasizes hands-on experience through laboratory exercises and flight training, preparing students for success in this rapidly evolving field.
Accredidation: Accredited by Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI)

ProgramName: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Options include: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (Internet-based); International English Language Testing Service (IELTS) Academic test with a minimum score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic test with a minimum score of 53; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 100; or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to MTSU is a separate procedure from admission to an academic program. After being admitted to the University, students desiring to major in Aerospace must meet the following requirements to be admitted to the program:

Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA
Completion of MATH 1710 College Algebra (or higher)
Completion of ENGL 1010
Completion of AERO 1010
Minimum grade of "C" in all Aerospace courses
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: MTSU's Aerospace professional program prepares students for careers in the aviation and aerospace industries. With seven concentrations, the program offers a variety of educational and career paths. The Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) Technology concentration is for students who are interested in careers involving the design, development, and application of unmanned aircraft systems and their components. This concentration provides a solid foundation in the science and engineering of unmanned aircraft systems. Graduates are prepared for careers in the UAS industry as researchers, developers, and operators of UAS systems. The program consists of a total of 120 credit hours.
Accredidation: The Aerospace Department is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $2,000 to $5,000 per year. Additional departmental scholarships are available.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all students whose native language is not English. Acceptable proofs of proficiency include: TOEFL (71 iBT / 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you should complete the required 16 college preparatory courses in high school and have either: A 3.0 GPA or higher OR; A minimum 2.7 GPA and a 19 ACT (990 SAT) or higher OR; A minimum score of 21 ACT (1060 SAT) regardless of GPA. MTSU offers a Test Optional pathway for Fall 2024, Spring 2025, and Summer 2025: Applicants who do not meet the test score requirements for regular admission, can be considered test optional with a 3.0+ high school GPA.
Department: School of Agriculture
Description: Agribusiness encompasses the business aspects of food, fiber, and environmental systems. From producers to consumers, agribusiness applies business principles in a variety of related fields. At MTSU, the Agribusiness program offers an outstanding education focusing on management, marketing, finance, policy, and other business applications relevant to the agribusiness industry. An Agribusiness degree prepares students for a wide range of careers in agriculture, food, finance, policy, and environmental sectors. Some potential careers are: Farm Management, Agricultural Marketing, Lending, Policy Analysis, Environmental Management, Commodities Brokerage, and many more.

EnglishScore: International applicants from non-native English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 61, TOEFL PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, Duolingo English Test 95, or an ELS Level 112 Certificate of Completion. Certain exemptions apply.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following:

22 ACT composite (or 1100 SAT total) OR
3.0 GPA

Test scores are not required for admission. If you apply without test scores, you must have a 3.0 high school GPA for an admission decision. If you choose to submit scores, they must be sent directly from the testing agency.
Department: School of Agriculture
Concentration: Equine Science, Livestock/Meat Science, Pre-Veterinary Medicine
Description: The Animal Science B.S. program is for students who love animals and want to make a difference in the lives of animals and humans. The program includes the study of animal physiology, nutrition, reproduction, genetics, and health. Students will gain hands-on experience working with a variety of animals, including horses, cattle, sheep, goats, and swine. The program prepares students for careers in animal agriculture, veterinary medicine, animal research, and other animal-related fields. Graduates are well-prepared for roles in areas such as animal breeding, animal health, animal nutrition, and farm management. The curriculum covers both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, ensuring students are ready for the challenges of a dynamic industry. Additionally, students have opportunities to participate in internships, research projects, and extracurricular activities such as judging teams and student organizations, further enhancing their educational experience.

EnglishScore: Proficiency in the English language must be demonstrated before regular admission will be granted. Students may submit one of the following to meet English proficiency: TOEFL iBT minimum score of 61, IELTS minimum score of 5.5, PTE Academic minimum score of 50, Duolingo minimum score of 95, ELS Language Center - Level 112 Certificate of Completion, Successful completion of 24 semester hours at a U.S. college or university, Citizens from an English-speaking country.
Requirements:
Admission to the university is assured for applicants who meet one of the following:

Option 1: 3.0 GPA or higher

Option 2: 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent)

Option 3: 2.7 GPA, 19 ACT (or SAT equivalent), and a grade of C or better in all core classes

Option 4: The student’s GPA and test score combination are reviewed based on our Freshman Admission Standards table.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: Anthropology is the scientific study of humankind in all times and places. It is a broad field, making it an excellent major for students who are fascinated by people and culture and who seek to understand a variety of societies, both past and present. The curriculum is designed to give students a comprehensive background in the four major subfields of anthropology: cultural anthropology, archaeology, biological anthropology, and linguistic anthropology. Students are also trained in qualitative and quantitative research methods appropriate to these subfields. Graduates with a B.A. or B.S. in Anthropology are prepared for entry-level professional positions in a wide array of fields, including cultural resource management, museums, non-profit organizations, and government agencies. The program also provides a strong foundation for students who plan to pursue graduate studies in anthropology or related fields such as public health, international relations, library science, or law.

ProgramName: Art Education, Art Education K-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by any ONE of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT). IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 5.5. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 47. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90. Successful completion of ELS (English Language Services) Language Center's level 112.
Requirements: Prior to enrolling in any upper-division (3000-4000 level) courses, students must be fully admitted to the Teacher Education Program. Requirements for admission include at least a 2.75 overall GPA, successful completion of the Praxis Core Academic Skills Test for Educators (or equivalent ACT/SAT scores), and passing a formal interview.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Concentration: Art Education K-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration
Description: The Art Education, K-12 Licensure program leads to a Bachelor of Science degree in Art and prepares candidates to teach art in elementary, middle, and high schools. Graduates of the program are eligible for the Tennessee Teacher License, Apprenticeship License (Professional Teaching License). Students are immersed in a balance of coursework designed to develop the knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to teach art in public and private schools. Emphasis is placed on studio competencies, art historical knowledge, contemporary art issues, professional practices, and effective teaching methodologies for K-12 settings. Students complete professional education coursework and comprehensive art studio courses from across the art disciplines. Art Education courses provide instruction in classroom management, content-specific methodologies, lesson/unit planning, assessment, and the use of technology to enhance teaching and learning.
Accredidation: MTSU's teacher licensure programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English. This can be met by providing an official score report for one of the following: Minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL, Minimum score of 61 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), Minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS, Minimum score of 48 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE), Minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test, or Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.
Requirements: Admission to the Department of Art and Design requires the completion of the University’s general education requirements for admission. General freshman admission requirements include completing the undergraduate application, paying the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submitting an official high school transcript. Submission of official ACT or SAT scores is optional for students with a 3.0 GPA or higher.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Fees: In-State: $9,828/Year; Out-of-State: $30,348/Year (based on 2024-2025 rates for full-time students, including mandatory fees)
Description: MTSU's Bachelor of Science (B.S.) or Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Art with a concentration in Art History provides a foundation in the visual arts with a strong emphasis on the history and theory of art. Students explore art and architecture from ancient to contemporary periods, gaining critical thinking skills, research abilities, and a deep understanding of cultural contexts. The curriculum prepares students for graduate studies, museum careers, art dealing, art criticism, and other related fields.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $323/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1178/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 tuition-only rates, other fees apply)

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for international applicants. Accepted methods include a minimum TOEFL score of 525 (PBT) or 71 (iBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Graphic Design concentration is selective. Students enter the B.F.A. in Art as 'pre-Graphic Design' majors and apply for the B.F.A. in Graphic Design candidacy by submitting a portfolio for review during the semester they are taking ART 2320 Typographic Design II. Students who successfully pass the portfolio review will be granted access to upper-division Graphic Design coursework.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The graphic design concentration provides a professional education built on a foundation of intellectual, aesthetic, and technical skills necessary to compete in the contemporary design field. Students are challenged to develop creative problem-solving skills and critical thinking while gaining a comprehensive understanding of current and emerging media in a changing global culture. The curriculum promotes social and environmental responsibility, professional ethics, and leadership. Graduate students may concentrate in a studio area or visual culture studies. The master's program is a flexible program structured to accommodate a wide variety of individual student goals. The program has produced working artists, designers, art historians, and teachers.
Accredidation: Accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD)

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for international applicants from non-English speaking countries. This can be demonstrated through various tests, including a minimum score of 70 on TOEFL iBT, 6.0 on IELTS, 95 on Duolingo, 48 on PTE Academic, or by completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
To apply to the B.F.A. in Studio Art, students must first be admitted to the University. Visit the Undergraduate Admissions Office website for University requirements. Admission to the Department of Art and Design for the B.F.A. in Art with a Studio Art Concentration is a separate process. Students apply directly to the Department of Art and Design after completing a specific sequence of foundation-level courses.

Departmental Admission: Upon successful completion of the Studio Art Foundations courses with an average of B (3.00) or better, students may apply to the B.F.A. program. Application must be made to the Department of Art and Design during the fourth week of the semester in which the candidate is completing the Foundations program. The candidate must present a portfolio of selected works from the Foundations courses to a faculty committee for review and possible acceptance into the B.F.A. degree program. The portfolio should represent the student's best works from ART 1610 - Drawing I, ART 1620 - 2-D Design, ART 1630 - Drawing II, and ART 1640 - 3-D Design. The student's overall GPA will also be considered.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts (B.F.A.) degree in Studio Art provides students with an immersive experience in the practice, theory, and history of art. It prepares students for successful careers as professional artists, for graduate study, and for a variety of careers in the visual arts field. Undergraduate students pursuing the B.F.A. in Studio Art choose one of the following concentrations: Ceramics, Drawing, Graphic Design, Illustration, Painting, Photography, Printmaking, or Sculpture. The B.F.A. in Studio Art is the most intensive undergraduate degree offered by the Department of Art and Design. It provides an opportunity for students to develop a body of work in a concentration area that demonstrates a high level of technical and conceptual sophistication. Students are challenged to develop a mature vision through critical dialogue with faculty and peers. Graduates of the program will have a deep understanding of contemporary art practices and theory, along with the skills necessary to pursue their artistic goals.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL (iBT 61 or PBT 500), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Art, Visual Arts Concentration, B.S./B.A. requires the following: Submission of a departmental application. Submission of a portfolio. Admission to the Department of Art and Design for the B.A. and B.S. is based on submission of a portfolio of 10-15 images of original artwork that represents the applicant's abilities. Portfolios are reviewed once each semester for admission the following semester. Fall Deadline: April 1; Spring Deadline: Nov. 1. Students are notified of their status by mail within a month of the deadline. Students not admitted may re-apply the following semester. A student transferring to MTSU who wishes to declare an Art major is expected to have a minimum 2.00 GPA.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description:
The Department of Art and Design offers two undergraduate degrees: a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) and a Bachelor of Science (B.S.). The B.A. degree provides students with a broad background in the visual arts with general education courses outside of the major. The B.S. degree focuses on a professional education, allowing for more studio coursework and fewer general education courses. Both degrees prepare students for careers in art and design or for graduate study.

The department offers 11 concentrations including ceramics, graphic design, illustration, photography, painting, printmaking, sculpture, and visual arts education. The Visual Arts concentration, B.A. or B.S., provides students with a broad general background in the visual arts and the flexibility to pursue individual interests. Students may specialize in two or more media areas, such as painting and sculpture, or create a multidisciplinary course of study. In addition, the Visual Arts concentration provides ideal preparation for the Master of Arts in Visual Arts (MAVA) program at MTSU.
Accredidation: MTSU is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC). The Department of Art and Design is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

EnglishScore: International students applying for admission to MTSU must show proof of English proficiency. This can be satisfied by submitting one of the following: a TOEFL score of 525 PBT (paper-based test) or 71 iBT (internet-based test); an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0; a Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) score of 48; a Duolingo English Test score of 95; or completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: MTSU uses a comprehensive review process for admission that includes both your high school GPA and your test scores (ACT or SAT). Assured Admission: High school GPA of 3.0 or higher AND ACT composite of 22 or higher (or SAT of 1100 or higher). Test Optional Admission (through Summer 2025): High School GPA of 3.5 or higher. Holistic Review: Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic and non-cognitive achievements.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The B.S. in Biology provides a broad foundation in the biological sciences. The curriculum is flexible enough to permit students to customize their program of study to prepare for graduate school, health-related professional programs, or immediate employment. Our graduates are competitive for admission to medical, dental, optometry, pharmacy, veterinary, and other health-related professional schools. Our graduates are also qualified for graduate study in a wide array of biological fields. Employment opportunities exist in various areas, including federal, state, and local agencies (e.g., Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency, Tennessee Department of Environment and Conservation, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, National Park Service, etc.), environmental consulting firms, zoos and aquaria, natural history museums, and pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and other industries. Students also gain valuable real-world experience through internships with agencies such as the TWRA, TDEC, and local zoos and aquaria, as well as with local businesses and industries.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $4,500 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships.

EnglishScore: All undergraduate international students must submit proof of English proficiency by providing one of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 61, IELTS academic score of 5.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic score of 50, Duolingo score of 95, or completion of level 109 at an ELS Language Center. Other exemption criteria may apply.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying to a major. Please visit the Undergraduate Admissions website for admission requirements.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: A Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Chemistry at Middle Tennessee State University provides a comprehensive curriculum that emphasizes a fundamental understanding of chemical principles and practical laboratory skills. The program prepares students for various career paths in science, industry, government, and education, or for advanced studies in chemistry or related fields. With a strong focus on hands-on learning, research opportunities, and modern instrumentation, students gain the expertise necessary to tackle complex chemical challenges and contribute to scientific advancements. The program offers two concentrations: General Chemistry and Forensic Chemistry. Students also have the option to pursue a professional track certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS) for a more rigorous and research-intensive experience, which is highly recommended for those planning to attend graduate school or seeking advanced positions in industry.
Accredidation: Certified by the American Chemical Society (ACS)

EnglishScore: Undergraduate students who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency by meeting one of several requirements. Options include a minimum TOEFL score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), a minimum IELTS score of 5.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 47, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of level 109 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: Admission to the Teacher Education Program is a separate process from admission to the university. A student must meet the requirements for admission to the university and the requirements for admission to the Teacher Education Program. Please see an advisor for admission requirements for teacher education.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Chemistry majors in the Teacher Licensure (MTeach) Concentration prepare students for a career as a high school chemistry teacher. Students gain teaching experience through fieldwork in local schools, working with experienced chemistry teachers, and ultimately fulfilling the requirements for licensure in Tennessee.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores required for undergraduate admission are: TOEFL: 71 iBT / 525 PBT, IELTS: 6.0, PTE Academic: 48, Duolingo: 95, or ELS Language Center: Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must meet the following high school course requirements and one of the following: 3.0 GPA OR 22 ACT composite (1020 SAT). Required high school units: 4 English; 3 Math (Algebra I & II, Geometry); 2 Natural/Physical Science; 1 Social Studies; 1 U.S. History; 2 Foreign Language; 1 Visual or Performing Arts. All students must submit an application for admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is not required for applicants with a 3.0 high school GPA or greater.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Concentration: Business Education, International Business, General Business
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Commerce at Middle Tennessee State University prepares graduates to excel in diverse business environments. This comprehensive program provides students with a strong foundation in core business principles, including management, marketing, finance, accounting, and economics. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and effective communication, equipping students with the essential skills needed for successful careers in various industries or for pursuing advanced studies. With optional concentrations in Business Education, International Business, and General Business, students can tailor their degree to their specific career interests, ensuring they are well-prepared for the challenges and opportunities of the modern business world.

EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL: 61 IBT or 500 PBT, IELTS: 5.5, PTE Academic: 48, Duolingo: 95, ELS Language Center: Completion of Level 109, Michigan Test (MELAB): 72, Cambridge English Scale Score: 162.
Requirements: Guaranteed freshman admission is offered to applicants who meet one of the following: 3.0 cumulative high school GPA (test score not required) or 2.7 cumulative high school GPA and a 22 ACT (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements may be reviewed for admission on an individual basis.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Science in Communication prepares students for a wide variety of careers in fields such as broadcasting, journalism, advertising, public relations, public information, marketing, education, and human resources. The program also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in communication and related fields. Students will learn how to communicate effectively, think critically, solve problems, conduct research, and adapt to changing environments. The curriculum emphasizes both theoretical understanding and practical application, with opportunities for internships and experiential learning.

ProgramName: Communication, Culture and Social Influence Concentration, B.S./B.A.
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. One of the following test scores is required: TOEFL: 71 iBT / 525 PBT, IELTS: 6.0, PTE: 48, Duolingo: 95, ELS: Level 112.
Requirements: Meet ONE of the following: A 3.0 GPA with no minimum test score; A 2.7 GPA and a minimum 19 ACT or 990 SAT; A 2.5 GPA and a minimum 21 ACT or 1060 SAT.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description:
The Communication Studies major focuses on the study of communication processes, messages, and meaning. It helps students understand human interaction through the exploration of various theories and contexts. Students develop strong critical thinking, research, writing, and speaking skills that are essential in nearly every profession.
The Communication, Culture and Social Influence concentration helps students understand how people are influenced by and interact with their social world and culture. Students in this concentration learn to evaluate, analyze, and apply communication theories related to social influence and culture. Graduates are prepared for careers that involve understanding and influencing attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors across various cultural contexts.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores are: TOEFL PBT 500, TOEFL iBT 61, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 43, Duolingo 95, or completion of ELS Language Center's level 112.
Requirements: Application requirements are for general university admission. To be considered for admission to the university, applicants must submit an application, a $25 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Middle Tennessee State University provides a test-optional path for undergraduate admission, meaning ACT/SAT scores are not required for students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Assured university admission can be met by one of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; 2.99-2.70 GPA and at least an 18 ACT or 940 SAT; 2.69-2.50 GPA and at least a 19 ACT or 980 SAT; 2.49 or lower GPA and at least a 21 ACT or 1060 SAT. According to the university catalog, admission to the University does not guarantee admission to the Communication major. To be admitted to the major, students must have a 2.50 overall GPA.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: The Organizational Communication concentration gives students the skills and knowledge to analyze, manage, and solve communication-related challenges within professional settings. Students learn about leadership, teamwork, negotiation, and cross-cultural communication, preparing them for careers in human resources, training and development, corporate communication, and non-profit management. Graduates are equipped to facilitate effective communication and foster positive organizational cultures.

ProgramName: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: 71 iBT (or 525 PBT), IELTS: 6.0, PTE Academic: 48, Duolingo English Test: 95, ELS: Completion of Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following: a 3.0 GPA; a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT equivalent); or a GPA below 2.7 with an ACT score of 22 (or SAT equivalent). Test score submission is optional for students with a 3.0 GPA or higher. Submission is encouraged for all students for scholarship consideration and course placement. MTSU does not require the writing component of the ACT or SAT.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: MTSU's Computer Science Bachelor of Science degree offers a concentration in Artificial Intelligence. This concentration provides students with a strong foundation in computer science and specialized knowledge and skills in artificial intelligence. This includes areas such as machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics. Graduates will be prepared for careers in AI development, data science, machine learning engineering, and research, as well as for further graduate studies in AI or related fields.

ProgramName: Computer Science, Business Applications Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done in one of several ways: TOEFL - 71 (Internet-based) or 525 (Paper-based); IELTS - 6.0; PTE Academic - 48; Duolingo - 95; ELS Language Center - Completion of Level 112.
Requirements: Regular admission is granted to students who have a 3.0 GPA or an ACT composite of 22 (or SAT total of 1100) and have completed the required high school curriculum. Note: MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admissions consideration for students applying for the Fall 2021 through Spring 2025 terms. Admission to the Computer Science program also requires a separate application process to the upper division after admission to the University.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Business Applications Concentration is for students wishing to apply computing to the solution of business problems and integrate computing with other business disciplines. This concentration also provides an excellent background for graduate study in business or computer science.

ProgramName: Computer Science, Cybersecurity Systems Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Official test scores are required for applicants from non-native English speaking countries. Students must submit one of the following: TOEFL: 61 iBT / 500 PBT; IELTS: 5.5; PTE Academic: 48; Duolingo: 95; ELS Language Center: Completion of Level 109; Michigan English Test (MET): 52.
Requirements: Admission to the Computer Science major requires an overall GPA of 2.00. First-time freshmen may be admitted directly to the major. Others may be admitted as pre-majors until they have a declared major GPA of 2.00 or better in at least 12 hours of CSCI courses taken at MTSU.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Cybersecurity is a rapidly growing field with an increasing demand for skilled professionals.
