MTSU’s Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with a concentration in Cybersecurity Systems prepares students for careers in this vital area. Students in the Cybersecurity Systems Concentration learn to apply principles of computer science to design, develop, and implement secure computer systems. They develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills to protect information systems from cyber threats, ensuring data confidentiality, integrity, and availability. This program covers topics such as network security, cryptography, secure software development, digital forensics, and ethical hacking. Graduates are well-prepared for roles as cybersecurity analysts, security engineers, incident responders, and other cybersecurity-related positions in various industries, government agencies, and consulting firms.

ProgramName: Computer Science, Professional Computer Science Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (internet-based); IELTS score of 6.0; PTE Academic score of 48; Duolingo English Test score of 100; Completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112; Michigan Test (MELAB) score of 77.
Requirements: MTSU will continue its test-optional admission policy for students applying. Students who do not submit ACT/SAT scores will be reviewed for admission based on their high school grade point average (GPA). Meet one of the following criteria: 22 ACT composite (or 1100 SAT equivalent) OR 3.0 high school GPA.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Computer Science B.S. program is designed for students who want to develop strong programming and technical skills. The Professional Computer Science concentration provides an in-depth study of algorithms, data structures, operating systems, software engineering, and artificial intelligence. This concentration prepares students for a wide range of careers in software development, data science, cybersecurity, and more. Students in the Professional Computer Science concentration will learn to: Design, develop, and test software systems. Analyze and solve complex computational problems. Apply data structures and algorithms effectively. Understand and implement operating system principles. Develop skills in artificial intelligence and machine learning. Collaborate on software projects using industry-standard practices.

ProgramName: Concrete Industry Management, Concrete Contracting Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency by meeting one of several requirements, including a TOEFL score of 61 iBT (or 500 PBT), an IELTS score of 5.5, a PTE Academic score of 48, a Duolingo score of 95, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 109. Exemptions are available for students from certain English-speaking countries or who meet other specific criteria.
Requirements: Regular admission is granted to students with a 3.0 GPA, regardless of test score (test optional), OR a 2.7 GPA with a 20 ACT/1020 SAT. Students with a 2.7 GPA and no test score will have a comprehensive review of their high school record. Applicants with a GPA below 2.7 will be holistically reviewed based on a combination of test scores, high school grades, and other information provided with the application.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at MTSU is a one-of-a-kind degree program that gives students a four-year Bachelor of Science degree in a professional program that will prepare them for a management career in the concrete industry. The mission of the CIM program is to produce broadly educated, articulate graduates grounded in basic business management, who are knowledgeable of concrete technology and are able to manage people and systems within the concrete industry.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $3,000 to $6,000 per year. The Concrete Industry Management program specifically distributes over $100,000 annually in scholarships.

ProgramName: Concrete Industry Management, Production, Sales and Service Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All international applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be satisfied by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (54), Duolingo English Test (105), or ELS Language Center (Level 112).
Requirements: MTSU is a test-optional university. ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission but are used for scholarship and course placement consideration. ASSURED ADMISSION: 3.0 GPA OR; 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT) OR; GPA below 2.7 and 24 ACT (1160 SAT). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be considered for admission under a holistic review. The holistic review will consider GPA, test scores (if submitted), and high school academic coursework.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: As the only program of its kind in the world, the Concrete Industry Management (CIM) program at Middle Tennessee State University has become the gold standard for producing graduates in the concrete industry. Students are prepared for a variety of careers in the concrete industry including production, sales, and service. All students enrolled in the CIM program are required to complete a minor in Business Administration. In addition to a broad education and general business courses, CIM students take a wide range of concrete-specific courses, which include subjects such as concrete properties, concrete construction, testing, materials, production, sales, and management. Experiential learning is a key component of the CIM program. Students complete two paid summer internships with CIM Patrons, one of the two national organizations that support the CIM program. Most students also choose to participate in the CIM student organization, which offers additional opportunities for learning and networking. For more information, visit the Department of Concrete Industry Management.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $330/credit hour (base maintenance fee); Out-of-State: $1,204/credit hour (base maintenance fee + out-of-state tuition)

ProgramName: Construction Management, Commercial Construction Management Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants must prove English proficiency. Accepted methods include a minimum TOEFL score of 71 (Internet-based) or 525 (paper-based), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo score of 95, or completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112 Intensive English Program.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit an application and an official high school transcript. Assured Admission requires one of the following: 3.0 GPA OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements or choose not to submit test scores can be reviewed for admission on an individual basis.
Department: School of Concrete and Construction Management
Description: MTSU's B.S. in Construction Management with a Commercial Construction Management Concentration focuses on the commercial and industrial sectors of the construction industry. This includes commercial buildings, industrial facilities, heavy-highway construction, utilities infrastructure, and related fields. The program emphasizes both management and technology, preparing students to lead and innovate in a dynamic global industry. Our curriculum provides a strong foundation in construction methods, materials, structural systems, project management, estimating, scheduling, safety, and business principles relevant to the construction industry. Graduates are equipped with the technical skills and leadership abilities to manage complex construction projects from conception to completion. The program aims to develop highly competent construction professionals capable of effective decision-making, problem-solving, and ethical practice within the construction domain.
Accredidation: The Construction Management program at MTSU is accredited by the American Council for Construction Education (ACCE). ACCE is recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) as the accrediting agency for baccalaureate and master's degree programs in construction education.
ScholarshipAmount: Program-specific scholarships typically range from $1,000 - $2,500. University-wide guaranteed academic scholarships for freshmen range from $3,500 to $5,000 per year.

ProgramName: Construction Management, Land Development/Residential Building Construction Management Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met in one of the following ways: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) on the TOEFL; a minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 109.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU does not guarantee admission to the Concrete Industry Management or Construction Management program. All students enter the program under a pre-major status. To be admitted to the major, students must have completed a minimum of 30 semester hours with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.25, passed MATH 1710 (or higher), and passed CIM 1010 or ET 1110 with a C or better.
Department: School of Concrete and Construction Management
Description: The Construction Management Program prepares students for a management career in the construction industry. With an average of over 200 students per year and four full-time faculty members, it is one of the largest programs of its type in Tennessee. The program offers five concentrations: Commercial, Concrete Industry Management, Electrical, Mechanical, and Land Development/Residential Building Construction Management. Our graduates find careers as project managers, estimators, field engineers, superintendents, and material suppliers in both the private and public sectors. The program provides the students with an in-depth understanding of how to plan, organize, and control the entire construction process, from start to finish. Our curriculum focuses on a core of construction management principles, coupled with a solid business background, and then branches into specialized areas through the concentrations.
Accredidation: The Construction Management Program is accredited by the American Council for Construction Education (ACCE).

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met through one of several tests including a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 61, IELTS score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 47, Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: MTSU has adopted a test-optional admission policy. This means if you have a 3.0 GPA or higher, you do not have to submit ACT/SAT scores for an admission decision. Assured admission will be granted to students with a: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 19 or higher (or SAT of 990); OR A GPA between 2.7 - 2.99 and completion of the 16 college prep courses.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The university’s Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice program is designed for students interested in careers in policing, corrections, courts, law, and other related fields. The program teaches students how to apply sociological theories and methods to the analysis of crime and criminal behavior. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in both the public and private sector and for advanced studies in graduate or law school.

Requirements: For unconditional admission, you must have a 3.0 GPA OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent). We do holistic reviews on all applicants to ensure we are looking at the whole person. We encourage you to send any additional information you would like us to consider. A personal statement (optional), letters of recommendation, and an official seven-semester transcript may be requested. Test scores are now optional for admission but will be required for scholarship consideration and course placement in math and English.
Department: Jones College of Business
Description: The new Cybersecurity Management, B.S. program, offered by the Department of Information Systems and Analytics within the Jones College of Business, is designed to bridge the gap between technical expertise and business acumen, offering students a holistic education that prepares them for leadership roles in the rapidly evolving field of cybersecurity. Students will gain a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, risk management, data privacy, and compliance, while also developing essential business skills such as strategic planning, financial analysis, and project management. Graduates of the Cybersecurity Management program will be well-equipped to protect organizations from cyber threats, implement robust security measures, and navigate the complex regulatory landscape of the digital age. The B.S. program is designed to meet the growing demand for professionals who possess both strong technical skills and a comprehensive understanding of business operations and strategy. The curriculum focuses on the intersection of cybersecurity and business, preparing students to manage and implement cybersecurity strategies within an organizational context. Students will take courses that cover topics like network security, ethical hacking, digital forensics, cloud security, risk assessment, and legal and ethical issues in cybersecurity. The curriculum is designed to give students a comprehensive understanding of both the technical and managerial aspects of cybersecurity.

EnglishScore: MTSU requires proof of English proficiency for all international students. Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 61, TOEFL PBT score of 500, IELTS score of 5.5, PTE score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, or ELS Level 109, among other options.
Requirements: To be considered for guaranteed freshman admission, you must meet ONE of the following: 2.7 or higher cumulative high school GPA; Redesigned SAT score of 1020 or higher; ACT score of 20 or higher.
Department: College of Education
Description: The Elementary Education program at Middle Tennessee State University prepares graduates to teach grades K-5. The program is designed to provide students with the knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to be effective teachers in diverse elementary school settings. An Elementary Education major prepares students to teach in grades K-5, and students seeking licensure may choose one of three concentrations: Academic Concentration, Arts and Humanities, or STEM. This program emphasizes practical experiences in a variety of elementary school settings, culminating in a full semester of student teaching.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Emergency Management and Homeland Security, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL minimum score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT); IELTS minimum score of 5.5; PTE Academic minimum score of 45; Duolingo English Test minimum score of 95; or successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA.
Requirements:
MTSU practices assured admission for first-time freshmen. This means students who meet the following criteria will be admitted to the university.

Requirements:
Complete the college preparatory curriculum AND meet ONE of the following: 3.0 GPA OR ACT composite of 22 or higher OR SAT of 1100 or higher.

College Preparatory Course Requirements: 4 English; 3 Math (Algebra I, II, Geometry or equivalent); 3 Natural/Physical Science; 1 Social Studies/Science; 1 U.S. History; 2 Foreign Language; 1 Fine Arts.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: Are you ready to respond to natural disasters, terrorist attacks, and other emergencies? Do you want to work to prevent these events, protect critical infrastructure, and help communities recover after incidents occur? Our B.S. in Emergency Management and Homeland Security prepares you for a challenging and rewarding career in this vital field. MTSU's Emergency Management and Homeland Security (EMHS) program is one of only a few in the nation. It provides students with a broad and comprehensive understanding of all-hazards mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery strategies and policies associated with emergencies and disasters. Students learn the tools and techniques utilized in the field, including geographic information systems (GIS), intelligence analysis, and exercise design. Our program also offers you the opportunity to pursue an accelerated B.S. to M.P.S. (Master of Professional Studies) program with a concentration in Strategic Leadership.

ProgramName: Engineering Technology, Computer Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following options: A minimum score of 525 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 71 on the internet-based test (iBT) TOEFL; A minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS; A minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; A minimum score of 100 on the Duolingo English Test; Successful completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: MTSU practices holistic review for undergraduate admission, meaning we look for students who have a high probability of success and who will persist to graduation. To determine this, we will review your high school academic performance and your ACT/SAT scores (if you choose to submit them). You must submit a final high school transcript upon graduation. High school graduates with a 3.0 GPA or higher are assured admission. OR High school graduates with a minimum 2.7 GPA and a 20 ACT (1020 SAT) are assured admission. Applicants who do not meet the assured admission requirements will be reviewed holistically.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: MTSU's B.S. in Engineering Technology with a concentration in Computer Engineering Technology is designed to develop the technical and managerial skills needed to prepare students for careers in the rapidly changing technological world. Students will learn the design, implementation, and maintenance of computer systems. This includes areas such as computer hardware, software, networking, and embedded systems. The Computer Engineering Technology program has laboratory-intensive courses that give students the hands-on experience needed for success in the workplace. Graduates will have the opportunity to work in various fields, including computer manufacturing, telecommunications, automation, and industrial control. In addition, graduates will be well-prepared to pursue advanced degrees in engineering or technology.

ProgramName: Engineering Technology, Electromechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All international students whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency test. Accepted tests include TOEFL with a minimum score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5, PTE Academic with a minimum score of 48, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95, or successful completion of Level 112 of the English Language Services (ELS) intensive program.
Requirements:
MTSU offers guaranteed admission to students who meet the following academic criteria:
- Complete the recommended high school curriculum
- Meet ONE of the following:
    - 3.0 GPA
    - 2.7 GPA AND 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite

Students who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic profile.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Electromechanical Engineering Technology concentration focuses on the integration of mechanical and electrical systems. Students develop expertise in areas such as robotics, automation, control systems, and manufacturing processes. This concentration prepares graduates for roles in industries requiring a blend of mechanical and electrical engineering skills.
Accredidation: The Engineering Technology B.S. program is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting a minimum score from TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, or by successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: For information regarding admission to the university, please visit the undergraduate admissions website at www.mtsu.edu/apply. In addition to university admission requirements, students should complete a geometry course and two years of algebra with a grade of C or better.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: This program prepares students for positions in engineering technology and provides skills to enter industries that require individuals to apply scientific and engineering principles to the design, analysis, and implementation of mechanical and manufacturing systems. Emphasis is placed on problem solving skills by combining theory and applications in areas such as product design, thermal fluid systems, controls, instrumentation, system integration, manufacturing processes, and quality control.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Science degree program in Engineering Technology is accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all international applicants. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL score of 71 (iBT) or 525 (PBT); IELTS score of 6.0; PTE Academic score of 48; Duolingo English Test score of 100; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112. Other exemptions exist for students from specific countries or with prior U.S. education.
Requirements: To be considered for guaranteed admission, you must meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA or 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Students who don't meet guaranteed admission requirements can be reviewed for holistic admission by submitting: An official high school transcript, An official ACT or SAT score, The personal statement portion of the application.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $2,000 to $5,000 per year.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all applicants whose native language is not English. This can be met by submitting a satisfactory score on the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, or Duolingo English Test, or by completing Level 112 of the ELS program.
Requirements: First-time freshmen who meet one of the following criteria are guaranteed admission to MTSU: 3.0 GPA OR 2.7 GPA and 20 ACT (1020 SAT) OR 2.5 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements may be considered for admission on a holistic basis. Required documents include an application for admission, a $25 application fee, official high school transcript(s), and official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional for most students).
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: Do you love to write? The Creative Writing program at MTSU offers you the chance to hone your skills in fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, playwriting, and screenwriting. Faculty members are award-winning published writers dedicated to teaching and mentoring students, and our small class sizes allow for individualized attention. Students enjoy a vibrant literary community with many opportunities to interact with visiting writers, take part in readings and open mics, and publish their work. The Creative Writing program offers students a comprehensive education in the craft and art of writing across genres while also providing a solid foundation in literature. Graduates pursue careers as writers, editors, teachers, and communicators in various fields, or continue their education in graduate programs such as the M.F.A.

ProgramName: English, English Language Linguistics Concentration, B.S./B.A.
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (53), Duolingo (100), or ELS (Completion of Level 112).
Requirements: To be fully admitted to the English B.A. program, students must have a 2.0 GPA.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The English B.A. with an English Language Linguistics Concentration includes coursework in the history of the English language, language structure, modern grammar, discourse analysis, and dialects. Students in this concentration may focus on applications of linguistics such as sociolinguistics, psycholinguistics, second language acquisition, or writing systems, as well as take advantage of hands-on opportunities in the linguistics lab. Graduates with this concentration may pursue careers in English language teaching (especially ESL/EFL), technical writing, editing, or publishing, or they may go on to graduate study in linguistics, speech pathology, or related fields.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following methods: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE (48), Duolingo English Test (95), or ELS (Level 109). Other tests and exemptions are also available.
Requirements:
MTSU offers assured admission to students who meet the following academic criteria:
- High school GPA of 3.0 or higher
- OR ACT composite score of 22 or higher
- OR SAT composite score of 1100 or higher

If you do not meet the assured admission criteria, your application will be reviewed to determine your probability of success.

MTSU offers test-optional admission to students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.

If you have a GPA below 3.0, you will need to submit ACT/SAT scores to be considered for admission:
- High school GPA of 2.7 or higher AND ACT composite score of 20 or higher OR SAT composite score of 1020 or higher
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: Students in the English major with the Literary Studies concentration acquire a broad understanding of literary traditions and genres and develop essential critical reading and analytical writing skills. The curriculum includes courses in British, American, and World Literatures, literary theory, and professional writing. Students in the concentration select an area of specialization from the following: American Literature, British Literature, World Literature, or Critical Theory.

ProgramName: English, Literature and Culture Concentration, B.A.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from admission to the English major. All English majors must meet the admission requirements of the University. To be considered for admission, prospective freshmen must meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA; 2.7 GPA and 21 ACT / 1060 SAT; 2.5 GPA and 23 ACT / 1130 SAT. MTSU is test-optional for admission. Freshman applicants with a 3.0 GPA may be admitted without a test score. Applicants with a 2.99 GPA or below should submit a test score for admission consideration.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Literature and Culture concentration within the English B.A. program offers students a solid foundation in the study of literature and culture, building critical reading and writing skills while preparing students for a variety of professions including education, law, business, and library and information science. Courses survey major authors, genres, and literary periods, and allow students to explore a range of topics including race, gender, and class; film studies; and the natural environment.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed freshman scholarships range from $2,000 to $6,000 per year.

ProgramName: English, Secondary English Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.
Requirements: Students must be formally admitted to the Teacher Education Program through the College of Education. Candidates must meet the following requirements to be considered for formal admission to the Teacher Education Program: Minimum overall GPA of 2.8. Passing scores on the Praxis CORE tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics) or a minimum ACT composite score of 21 or SAT composite score of 1020 (prior to 2016) or 1080 (2016 and after). Completion of ENGL 1010, 1020, and SPCH 1010/COMM 2200 with a grade of C or better. Successful completion of an interview. Completion of a minimum of 45 semester hours. Recommendation from academic advisor. Signed disposition form. Grade of C or better in all major required courses, if applicable. A clear background check.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The English, Secondary English Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A. provides students with a thorough background in English studies and prepares them for licensure as English teachers in grades 6-12. The program integrates coursework in English literature, language, and writing with professional education courses and extensive clinical experiences, including student teaching. Graduates are equipped to create engaging and effective learning environments, foster critical thinking and literacy skills, and meet the diverse needs of secondary English students.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (Internet-based), a 6.0 on the IELTS, a 95 on the Duolingo English Test, a 48 on the PTE Academic, or through completion of ELS Language Center level 112.
Requirements: MTSU practices rolling admission and will notify you of your admission decision after we receive all of your required documents. To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria: Assured Admission - 3.0 GPA; OR Holistic Review - 2.7 GPA OR 22 ACT/1100 SAT. A final high school transcript will be required to confirm graduation and final GPA. Required Application Documents: Completed online application for admission; Nonrefundable $25 application fee; Official high school transcript.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Concentration: Pre-Physical Therapy, Pre-Occupational Therapy, Strength and Conditioning, Allied Health
Description: Do you enjoy an active lifestyle and want to work with people? A B.S. in Exercise Science will provide you with the knowledge, skills, and abilities to enter various health and fitness careers or prepare for professional programs such as Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Cardiac Rehabilitation, Physician's Assistant, Athletic Training, Strength & Conditioning, Corporate Wellness, and other Allied Health professions. Our program emphasizes evidence-based practice and a hands-on learning approach. We provide students with opportunities for practical experience and exposure to various professional settings through internship opportunities, research, and community engagement. You can choose from four concentrations including: Pre-Physical Therapy, Pre-Occupational Therapy, Strength and Conditioning, and Allied Health.

EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores for undergraduate admission include TOEFL iBT 61, TOEFL PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, Duolingo 95, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: To be admitted to the Jones College of Business, a student must meet the following requirements: 1. Admission to MTSU. 2. An overall GPA of 2.25. 3. Completion of all lower-division business courses (ACTG 2110, BLAW 3400, ECON 2410, ECON 2420, INFS 3100, MATH 1630, and QM 2610) with a grade of C- or better.
Department: Jones College of Business
Concentration: Business Finance, Financial Institutions, Financial Planning, Real Estate
Description: Finance is the study of creating and managing money. The MTSU Finance program provides students with the theoretical and practical knowledge they need to pursue exciting careers. MTSU offers an interdisciplinary curriculum that enables students to gain the skills needed to enter a variety of financial careers including commercial banking, investments, insurance, corporate finance, financial planning, real estate, and government. Additionally, students can take electives in the areas of Business Finance, Financial Institutions, Financial Planning, and Real Estate. The Finance B.B.A. program offers students an opportunity to obtain the required knowledge to sit for professional designations such as Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Financial Planner (CFP), and Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter (CPCU).
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. You may submit one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 525 (paper-based), 195 (computer-based), or 71 (Internet-based). IELTS: Minimum score of 6.0. PTE: Minimum score of 48. Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 95. ELS: Completion of ELS Language Center's level 112.
Requirements: General university admission requirements for freshmen include a 3.0 GPA, OR a 2.5 GPA and an ACT score of 22 (or SAT of 1100). Test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission for first-time freshmen for Fall 2024. In addition to general university admission requirements, students seeking a B.B.A. degree from the Jones College of Business must meet the following requirements before taking upper-division business courses: completion of 60 semester hours; a minimum 2.25 cumulative GPA; and completion of all lower-division business courses with a C or better.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The Department of Economics and Finance offers a major in Finance (B.B.A.) with concentrations in Financial Management, Real Estate, and Financial Planning. Real Estate concentration students focus on the acquisition, financing, management, and marketing of real property. Real estate has long been an attractive area for investment and career opportunities. As a real estate major, you will study real estate law, valuation, brokerage, financing, development, and investment management. Career opportunities exist in residential and commercial real estate sales, appraisal, property management, mortgage lending, real estate development, and portfolio management. The finance-real estate concentration also offers elective courses in various topics suchs as derivatives, risk management, and international finance.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International – the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

EnglishScore: All international undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English language proficiency. This can be met with one of the following minimum scores: TOEFL iBT 61, TOEFL PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, Duolingo English Test 95, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 109. Other exemptions may also apply.
Requirements: Meet one of the following criteria: 2.7 GPA or 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Required High School Coursework: 4 units of English / 3 units of math (Algebra I, II, Geometry or equivalent) / 3 units of lab science / 1 unit of U.S. history / 1 unit of world history or geography / 2 units of the same foreign language / 1 unit of fine arts.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Forensic Science is a multidisciplinary field that combines natural sciences with law enforcement to provide crucial scientific evidence for legal proceedings. In this program, students will learn to apply scientific methods and techniques to analyze physical evidence, interpret findings, and present expert testimony in court. Through hands-on experiences, students will develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills essential for a successful career in forensic science. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including forensic chemistry, biology, toxicology, trace evidence analysis, crime scene investigation, and forensic pathology. Students will gain practical experience through laboratory work, internships, and research opportunities, preparing them for diverse roles in law enforcement agencies, crime laboratories, and government organizations.

Requirements: To be admitted to MTSU, you should have either: A cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher; OR An ACT composite of 22 or an SAT total of 1100 or higher; OR A cumulative high school GPA of 2.7 or higher AND an ACT composite of 19 or an SAT total of 990 or higher. MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admission for most students. Applicants who do not submit test scores will be reviewed for admission based on high school GPA.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
CostPerCredit: In-State: $705/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,507/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Varies; guaranteed scholarships range from $3,500 to $8,000 per year.

EnglishScore: For international applicants, English proficiency must be demonstrated. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo English Test (95), completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center, or other accepted criteria such as citizenship in an approved English-speaking country or graduation from a U.S. high school.
Requirements: First-time freshmen must submit the following: Application for admission and the nonrefundable application fee; Official high school transcript; Official ACT or SAT scores (optional for most applicants). Assured admission can be granted to students who have a 3.0 high school GPA regardless of ACT/SAT score. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 GPA must also have a 20 ACT or 1020 SAT score for assured admission. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Geosciences is designed to prepare students for careers or for graduate study in the geosciences. Geosciences is the study of the Earth, its materials, processes, products, and history. Earth's processes and products include minerals, rocks, soils, water, oceans, atmosphere, and life forms, as well as the dynamic forces that shape the planet's surface and interior. Earth scientists use the tools and methods of geology, geography, physics, chemistry, biology, and mathematics to investigate earth systems, understand Earth's past and present, and predict its future. Geosciences students may choose one of four concentrations: Geology, Environmental Geosciences, Physical Geography, or Earth Science Education. Coursework includes a combination of classroom, laboratory, and field-based learning experiences.

ProgramName: Global Studies and Human Geography, Global Studies Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Undergraduate international applicants must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting an official score from TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), or Duolingo English Test (95), or by completing ELS level 112. Other exemptions may apply.
Requirements:
An entering freshman must have a high school diploma and must meet one of the following criteria:
- 2.7 high school GPA or greater
- ACT composite score of 20 or greater (or concordant SAT score)
- GPA of 2.5-2.69 with an ACT composite of 16-19
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: Middle Tennessee State University's Bachelor of Science in Global Studies and Human Geography offers students an understanding of global connections, the human experience, and human-environment interactions. The Global Studies concentration offers a broad, interdisciplinary curriculum in international affairs, cultures, and global issues, preparing students for careers in diplomacy, foreign service, international business, and non-governmental organizations.

ProgramName: Global Studies and Human Geography, Human Geography Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Options include: TOEFL (minimum 71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum 54), Duolingo (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying to this major. Assured admission is granted to students with one of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1020. Students not meeting the assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. High school curriculum requirements: 4 units of English; 3 units of math (Algebra I, II, and Geometry or equivalents); 3 units of natural science; 1 unit of American history; 1 unit of European history, world history, or world geography; 1 unit of U.S. government or economics; 2 units of the same foreign language; 1 unit of visual or performing arts.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Fees: In-State: $4,999/Semester; Out-of-State: $14,947/Semester (based on 2024-2025 full-time, 12+ credit hours)
Description: Human Geography explores human interaction with the natural environment and the economic, political, and cultural forces affecting people and places. Global Studies focuses on global issues and the changing relationships between societies, cultures, and institutions. Both concentrations help students develop critical perspectives on global and local issues that affect humanity.
Accredidation: MTSU is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, master’s, specialist, and doctorate degrees. Degrees from programs are not individually accredited.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $422/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,251/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 rates for 1-11 hours)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $4,999/Semester; Out-of-State: $14,947/Semester (based on 2024-2025 full-time, 12+ credit hours)

EnglishScore: Undergraduate applicants must provide ONE of the following as proof of English proficiency: TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (53), Duolingo (95), or completion of ELS Level 112. Exemptions may apply for those who have completed English composition at a U.S. institution, graduated from a U.S. high school, or are citizens of countries where English is the official language.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying for a major. You may find admission information at the Undergraduate Admissions website.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: From the dawn of civilization to the present, history records the ideas and actions of humankind. As a History major at MTSU, you'll delve into the past to discover how events and issues have shaped our present and will influence our future. You'll analyze primary and secondary sources, learn about historical methodology and historiography, and hone your critical thinking, research, and writing skills. Students can choose to concentrate in American History or World History.

ProgramName: History, History 6-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.
EnglishScore: All international students are required to demonstrate English language proficiency in order to be admitted to MTSU. Proof of proficiency can be demonstrated by ONE of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 61 or higher / PBT score of 500 or higher; International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 5.5 or higher; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 48 or higher; Duolingo English Test score of 95 or higher; Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To apply, prospective students must complete the undergraduate application for admission, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of official ACT or SAT scores is optional for most applicants.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: As a History major at MTSU, you'll delve into the past to better understand the world around us. With four concentrations to choose from, you can focus on the areas that most interest you and prepare you for your career goals. This program offers students the opportunity to earn a B.A. or a B.S. in History with a concentration in History 6-12 Teacher Licensure. This concentration allows students to pursue a degree in History while also meeting the requirements for teacher licensure in Tennessee. Students interested in this concentration should contact the College of Education for information regarding specific course requirements and the application process for the teacher education program. Students are responsible for meeting all requirements for program admission, retention, and completion as outlined in the MTSU Undergraduate Catalog.

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 71 on the internet-based test (iBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum 6.0 score; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 59; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95; or completion of ELS Level 112. Exemptions may apply for students from certain English-speaking countries or with specific U.S. academic experience.
Requirements: MTSU offers two paths for guaranteed freshman admission. Path 1: 2.7 GPA or higher. Path 2: A minimum 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT total score) AND a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. Required Documents: Official High School Transcript. Test Scores (optional for applicants with 2.7+ GPA).
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Arts/Science in History with a concentration in Public History prepares students for a career in the dynamic field of public history. Public history is a broad array of activities, professions, and scholarship undertaken by people with historical training who work to engage the public with history. Public historians serve a diverse public and work in a variety of settings from museums and archives to state and national parks, historic sites, historical societies, and government agencies. Public historians conduct oral histories, process archives, curate exhibits, manage historic sites, develop interpretive programs, and provide public education. With this degree, you will learn practical skills that allow you to bring history to a public audience. You will learn to conduct historical research, apply historical knowledge and methods, engage in historical interpretation, and communicate history to a variety of audiences. You will also learn practical skills relevant to careers in public history, including archive and museum management, historic preservation, and oral history. This concentration is a good choice for students interested in careers in museums, archives, historic preservation, and cultural resource management. Our faculty are active scholars and experienced public historians who bring their expertise to the classroom.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $5,500 per year, with premier scholarships covering full tuition

EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency by providing an official score report for one of the following: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English), or Duolingo English Test.
Requirements:
For assured admission, first-time freshmen must meet one of the following criteria:
- 3.0 GPA
- 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT)

Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. A decision will be based on GPA, test scores, and high school coursework.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Middle Tennessee State University’s Horse Science program offers one of the most comprehensive university-level equine programs in the country, attracting students from across the United States and abroad. The program includes both a two-year Associate of Science and a four-year Bachelor of Science degree, with concentrations in Equine Industry or Science within the Bachelor of Science degree. Students gain real-world experience through classes taught in our university barn facilities. Through internships and active participation in competitive events, students apply their knowledge and skills in the equine industry. Located in Murfreesboro, TN, MTSU is centrally located in one of the largest horse centers in the country, giving students unique opportunities and access to the heart of the horse industry.

ProgramName: Human Performance, Exercise Science Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include a TOEFL score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), an IELTS score of 5.5, a PTE Academic score of 47, a Duolingo score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria:
22 ACT Composite or 1100 SAT (ERW+M)
or
3.5 high school GPA
or
3.0 high school GPA and 20 ACT or 1020 SAT (ERW+M)
or
2.7 high school GPA and a signed letter of recommendation from your principal or guidance counselor
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Exercise Science Concentration prepares students for careers in clinical settings such as cardiac rehabilitation, strength and conditioning, corporate wellness, health and fitness clubs, personal training, and a variety of other health-related fields. In addition, the Exercise Science Concentration provides an excellent foundation for graduate study in Exercise Science, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Chiropractic, and Medical School. The Exercise Science Concentration has two tracks: Pre-Physical Therapy and Exercise Science. While both tracks provide the prerequisite coursework for graduate school, the Pre-Physical Therapy track is designed for students desiring to enter a Doctor of Physical Therapy program. The Exercise Science track is designed for students desiring to enter a master's degree program in Exercise Science or work in a health/fitness related field.

ProgramName: Human Sciences, Fashion Merchandising Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Options include a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 61, IELTS score of 5.5, PTE score of 50, or Duolingo score of 95. Completion of ELS Language Center Level 109 also satisfies the requirement.
Requirements: Assured admission is granted to students with a standard high school diploma and a minimum 3.0 GPA, OR a standard high school diploma with a minimum 2.7 GPA AND an ACT composite of 22 or above (or 1100 SAT). Applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional for most applicants.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Textiles, Merchandising and Design major with a concentration in Fashion Merchandising will prepare students for careers in the dynamic global fashion industry. Students will gain knowledge and skills in areas such as fashion trends, product development, global sourcing, retail buying, visual merchandising, and entrepreneurship. The curriculum combines business principles with creative applications to provide a comprehensive understanding of the fashion supply chain, from design to consumer. Graduates will be equipped to pursue diverse roles in retail, wholesale, and related fashion sectors. As a student in the Fashion Merchandising concentration, you will gain skills and knowledge in a wide array of areas within the fashion industry, including: Fashion trend analysis; Product development and sourcing; Retail buying and planning; Visual merchandising and display; Marketing and promotion; E-commerce and digital merchandising; Supply chain management; Textile science; Fashion history and culture; Sustainability in fashion.

ProgramName: Human Sciences, Interior Design Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: For international applicants, one of the following is required to demonstrate English proficiency for admission: TOEFL score of 61 iBT (or 500 PBT), IELTS score of 5.5, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of ELS Language Center Level 109.
Requirements: Admission to the University allows students to declare a major in Interior Design. For students entering the program at the sophomore level or above, the Interior Design faculty will review the student's portfolio and transcripts to ensure proper placement in the Interior Design curriculum. To be considered for university admission as a first-time freshman, an applicant must have a 3.0 high school GPA OR a 2.7 high school GPA and an 18 ACT (or SAT equivalent).
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: Interior Architecture is the professional discipline of designing human environments. Interior Architecture focuses on both the practical and aesthetic considerations of building and renovating interior spaces. The curriculum provides students with a strong foundation in design, drawing, building systems, and materials and methods, all within the context of preparing students to sit for professional licensure. Graduates of the Interior Architecture program work in many areas, including commercial and residential design, furniture design, lighting design, sustainable design, and historic preservation.
Accredidation: The Interior Architecture (B.S.) program leading to the Bachelor of Science in Interior Architecture is accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA), 2060 Division Avenue, SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1621. Visit the CIDA website at www.accredit-id.org for more information.

ProgramName: Human Sciences, Nutrition and Food Science Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: To be considered for undergraduate admission, applicants must complete and submit the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Standardized test scores like the ACT or SAT are not required for admission for students with a 3.0 or higher GPA, but are recommended for scholarship consideration.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The B.S. in Human Sciences with a concentration in Nutrition and Food Science (NFS) prepares students for a variety of careers related to food, nutrition, and health. Students learn about food preparation, food safety, human nutrition, food science, and hospitality management. Graduates are prepared for careers in food service management, community nutrition, food industry, and government agencies. The NFS program is approved by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (AND) as a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD).
Accredidation: Approved by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics (AND) as a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD).
ScholarshipAmount: Ranges from $2,000 to $6,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

EnglishScore: All undergraduate applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: 61 on the iBT or 500 on the PBT; IELTS: 5.5; PTE Academic: 48; Duolingo English Test: 95; ELS Language Centers: Completion of Level 109.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Humanities combines the study of world cultures, literature, philosophy, and religion with a broad knowledge of human activity and creativity. Humanities students gain invaluable insight into complex ideas, critical thinking skills, and an awareness of social, economic, and political issues throughout history. You’ll be prepared for a wide variety of career options or continued study in graduate school including law, international affairs, human resources, public relations, social work, journalism, business, management, or library science.

Requirements:
Admission to the B.S. in Industrial-Organizational Psychology requires the following:
- 24 credit hours completed
- Cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher
- PSY 1410 (General Psychology) with a grade of C or better
- Submit an online application by the appropriate deadline: February 1 (for fall admission) or September 1 (for spring admission).
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: Industrial-Organizational (I-O) psychology is the scientific study of working and the application of that science to workplace issues facing individuals, teams, and organizations. I-O psychology is a growing field that applies psychological principles and research methods to optimize human potential in the workplace. I-O psychologists are scientists and practitioners who specialize in human behavior in the workplace. They are trained in the scientist-practitioner model, meaning they have expertise in both conducting research and applying research findings to real-world problems. The focus of I-O psychology is on increasing workplace effectiveness and employee well-being. As an I-O Psychology major, you will learn how to apply psychological principles to enhance individual and organizational performance in the workplace. You will develop critical thinking, research, and analytical skills necessary for success in various professional roles or for pursuing graduate studies in I-O psychology. Specific topics include personnel selection, performance management, training and development, leadership, motivation, organizational culture, and occupational health psychology. An I-O Psychology B.S. provides excellent preparation for entry-level positions in human resources, talent acquisition, organizational development, training, and data analysis. The major also serves as a strong foundation for pursuing graduate degrees in I-O Psychology, Human Resources, Business Administration, and related fields.

EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 61, a minimum TOEFL PBT score of 500, a minimum IELTS score of 5.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo score of 95, or successful completion of level 112 of the ELS Language Centers' English for Academic Purposes Program. Exemptions may apply.
Requirements: To be considered for regular admission, you must submit an application and meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 cumulative high school GPA OR 2.7 cumulative high school GPA AND 22 composite ACT or 1100 SAT OR Test Optional: 3.5 cumulative high school GPA.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: The B.B.A. in Information Systems provides students with the fundamental knowledge and skills needed to manage, design, develop, secure, and deploy information technology and systems. Graduates are highly sought after in the private and public sectors and assume positions such as business systems analysts, project managers, database administrators, network administrators, information systems auditors, and more. A degree in Information Systems is relevant to nearly every industry and profession, from health care to financial services to entertainment. Information Systems students are critical thinkers who understand both business and technology. Because businesses rely on computing technology to manage and organize data, improve efficiency, and develop innovative products and services, Information Systems graduates are highly valued. Our graduates are problem solvers who are able to bridge the gap between technical experts and business executives.
Accredidation: The Department of Information Systems and Analytics, located in the Jones College of Business, is AACSB accredited.

ProgramName: Integrated Studies, Applied Leadership Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International undergraduate students are required to show proof of English language proficiency by submitting one of the following options: a minimum score of 525 on the TOEFL PBT or 71 on the TOEFL iBT; a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 48 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; or successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: MTSU is a test-optional university. Submission of ACT/SAT scores is optional and not required for admission. For guaranteed admission, students must present a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.0. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 cumulative high school GPA will be reviewed for admission based on a combination of their GPA and ACT/SAT scores. Students who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic and supplemental information.
Department: University College
Description: The Integrated Studies, Applied Leadership (B.S.) concentration prepares students to apply principles and strategies of leadership and organizational dynamics in professional settings. This program is for students who have obtained an associate degree or have accumulated significant credit hours (60+) and desire to complete their bachelor's degree. Students completing this program will be equipped with critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills applicable to various careers, including business, non-profit, government, and education.
ScholarshipAmount: Up to full tuition and fees

Requirements: Admission to this program requires general admission to Middle Tennessee State University. According to the university's undergraduate admissions requirements, guaranteed admission for first-time freshmen requires a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 may be admitted with a minimum ACT score of 19 or SAT score of 990. MTSU is a test-optional institution.
Department: University College

ProgramName: Integrated Studies, Public Safety Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met through several options, including a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 61, a minimum IELTS score of 5.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Department: University College
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Integrated Studies (IS) provides a flexible, interdisciplinary program of study designed for students whose educational goals cannot be met by traditional majors. The IS major provides students with the critical thinking, communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills necessary to be successful in the workforce and for career advancement. The Public Safety Concentration is designed for students seeking entry-level positions or advancement in various public safety fields such as homeland security, emergency management, law enforcement, corrections, and fire services. Students completing the concentration will gain knowledge and skills in areas such as emergency planning, homeland security strategies, public safety administration, and critical incident management. The curriculum is interdisciplinary, drawing upon courses from Criminal Justice, Sociology, Psychology, Political Science, and other relevant departments.

EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done through a variety of ways, including minimum scores on tests such as TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), Duolingo (95), PTE Academic (48), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Assured admission will be granted to students with a 3.0 high school GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 high school GPA must have a 19 ACT or 990 SAT for assured admission. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed holistically. MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admissions consideration for applicants with a 3.0+ high school GPA.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Concentration: Animation, Audio Production, Design, Game Development, Photography, Video and Film Production, Web Development
Description: The Interactive Media (IM) program at MTSU is an interdisciplinary Bachelor of Science degree offered through the College of Media and Entertainment. IM merges the creative power of art, audio, video, photography, web, and animation with the technical skills to create professional interactive content across many industries. Students gain broad exposure to interactive media concepts, theories, technologies, and applications, and also delve into a specific concentration related to their interests. With this degree, graduates are prepared to pursue a wide range of careers in dynamic and rapidly evolving industries. The IM program is part of the Department of Media Arts within the College of Media and Entertainment, which offers many student opportunities through state-of-the-art facilities and equipment (including a virtual production lab), professional internship opportunities, student organizations, and a faculty of highly qualified scholars and industry professionals.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and scores include a minimum TOEFL score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), an IELTS overall band score of 5.5, a PTE Academic score of 48, or a Duolingo English Test score of 85. Successful completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 also meets this requirement.
Requirements: Students intending to major in Interior Design must meet the University’s general admission requirements.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Interior Architecture, B.S. program combines an understanding of the built environment and human interaction within that environment with an artistic eye for aesthetics and design. This bachelor of science degree program prepares students for the wide range of challenges and exciting opportunities that exist within the profession of interior design and architecture today. Students learn to provide innovative and creative design solutions for interiors ranging from residential and retail spaces to corporate, healthcare, and educational facilities, all while ensuring safety, functionality, and sustainability. Upon completion of the Interior Architecture program, you will be prepared for a wide range of career options and graduate study. The Interior Architecture Program is committed to preparing students for diverse careers within the broad field of interior design. Our curriculum is steeped in a studio-based, hands-on learning environment with courses taught by experienced design professionals. Studio projects focus on a variety of commercial and residential design problems with an emphasis on sustainable design solutions, building codes, universal design, and construction practices.
Accredidation: The Interior Architecture, B.S. is accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA).

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met with ONE of the following: TOEFL: 71 (Internet-based), 525 (Paper-based), or 195 (Computer-based); IELTS: 6.0; PTE Academic: 48; Duolingo: 95; ELS Language Center: Completion of Level 112; SAT: 500 on the Reading and Writing section; ACT: 21 on English and Reading sections; Completion of English composition I and II with a C or better from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university; Graduation from a U.S. high school with regular placement in English and three years of attendance.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria:
Guaranteed Admission
- High school GPA of 3.0 or higher
- OR a GPA of 2.7+ and an ACT of 22+ (or SAT equivalent)
Admission by Review
- High school GPA of 2.7 to 2.99 with no test scores
- OR a high school GPA below a 2.7 and a test score of 19-21 ACT (or SAT equivalent)
- OR a high school GPA of 2.5 or higher and no test score.
Applicants will be asked to submit a personal statement form.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: International relations focuses on the changing political, economic, and cultural relations between countries, international organizations, and transnational corporations. An interdisciplinary degree emphasizing analytical skills, cultural awareness, and foreign language proficiency, it provides a solid liberal arts foundation for students interested in careers in government, foreign service, diplomacy, international business, teaching, and journalism. Our graduates have pursued careers in a number of fields including foreign service, law, international business, politics, higher education, and journalism.

EnglishScore: For international students from non-English speaking countries, proof of English proficiency is required. Options include TOEFL with a minimum score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5, PTE Academic with a minimum score of 46, Duolingo with a minimum score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 109 English for Academic Purposes.
Requirements: Admission to the School of Journalism and Strategic Media is separate from admission to the university. To be admitted as a major in the School, a student must have completed 30 semester hours with a 2.50 grade point average and have passed the school’s Entrance Exam. Students may apply for admission as a pre-major after being admitted to the university. An overall GPA of 2.25 is required to graduate. For additional information about the Entrance Exam, students should contact the school.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: Ready to take your passion for news, sports or visual storytelling and turn it into a career? The School of Journalism and Strategic Media at MTSU gives you the opportunity to do just that as you learn to create powerful stories that can change the world. With three concentrations (Visual Storytelling, News and Sports Media), you will develop the skills to write, edit and produce content for media outlets ranging from digital to print and broadcast. Along the way you will learn how to gather information, develop sources, and craft professional stories in a variety of mediums. You will learn from veteran journalists who have years of experience in the field, including award-winning reporters, editors and producers. Through the College of Media and Entertainment, you will also have opportunities to participate in internships, student organizations and campus media, where you will gain valuable real-world experience.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency.
Requirements: For guaranteed admission to the university, freshmen must have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite score of 22 or higher OR an SAT composite score of 1100 or higher. Applicants who do not meet these requirements can be considered for admission by review. Additionally, admission to the College of Media and Entertainment requires a 2.00 cumulative GPA. To be admitted to the Journalism major, students must earn a C or better in JOUR 2710.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description:
Journalism plays a vital role in an informed society, and its principles are critical to modern communication. MTSU’s program focuses on core journalism values, including ethics, critical thinking, clarity, and accuracy, while providing students with practical skills in a rapidly evolving media landscape. Students learn how to analyze events and issues; gather, synthesize, and report information; and understand the role of journalism in a diverse, democratic society.

Students choose from concentrations in Advertising, Digital Journalism, Entertainment Journalism, or Public Relations. Our graduates work in a variety of media fields, including newspapers, magazines, television, radio, and online publications. Many also pursue careers in advertising, public relations, and corporate communications.

ProgramName: Journalism, Environmental Journalism and Communication Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency through one of the following: TOEFL iBT (minimum score 61), IELTS (minimum score 5.5), Duolingo English Test (minimum score 95), PTE (minimum score 51), or completion of ELS Level 112. Other exemptions may also apply.
Requirements: MTSU is test-optional for admissions purposes for students with a 3.0 or higher high school GPA. Regular Admission requires a 3.0 high school GPA OR a 2.7 high school GPA and a 20 ACT (1020 SAT) composite. Conditional Admission is possible with a 2.7 GPA and an 18-19 ACT (940-1010 SAT) composite.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: The Environmental Journalism and Communication concentration provides students with the critical skills needed to report on environmental issues for a variety of media outlets. Through coursework and experiential learning opportunities, students gain an understanding of environmental science, policy, and ethics, as well as the ability to communicate complex scientific information to the public in an engaging and accessible manner. Graduates are prepared for careers in environmental reporting, science communication, public relations, and advocacy for environmental organizations.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC)
CostPerCredit: In-state: $441/credit hour; Out-of-state: $1,223/credit hour (based on 2023-24 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: $1,000 - $5,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL: 500 PBT or 61 IBT; IELTS: 5.5; PTE: 48; ELS Language Center: Level 112; Duolingo: 95.
Requirements: Assured admission is granted to students who meet ONE of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA, OR; 2.7 GPA and an ACT composite of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent), OR; 22 ACT composite or higher (or SAT equivalent). MTSU is a test-optional university through Fall 2025. Students may apply for admission with or without an ACT or SAT score.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: MTSU’s Bachelor of Science in Journalism with a concentration in Investigative Journalism provides students with comprehensive instruction in the fundamentals of journalism along with specialized skills and knowledge required for investigative reporting. Students learn to conduct in-depth research, analyze complex data, interview sources, and produce compelling investigative stories across various media platforms. The program emphasizes ethical practices, critical thinking, and advanced reporting techniques essential for uncovering truth and holding power accountable.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by ONE of the following: TOEFL: a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based test or 71 on the internet-based test (iBT); IELTS: a minimum band score of 6.0; PTE Academic: a minimum score of 48; Duolingo English Test: a minimum score of 95; ELS Language Centers: completion of level 112.
Requirements: Applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional for applicants with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. For assured admission, applicants need a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher, OR an ACT composite score of 22 or higher, OR an SAT total score of 1100 or higher. Applications that do not meet assured admission requirements will undergo a holistic review.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: Journalism and Strategic Media’s Media Design concentration helps students develop critical skills in the use of design principles, communication theory, and media technology. Courses include digital image making, animation, digital video, web design, and graphic design. Graduates are prepared for careers as graphic designers, web designers, video producers, animators, illustrators, motion graphics designers, and user experience (UX) designers. The concentration also allows students to pursue graduate school.
Accredidation: The School of Journalism and Strategic Media is accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC).
CostPerCredit: TN Resident: $334/credit hour; Non-TN Resident: $1,174/credit hour (plus fees)
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $2,000 to $5,000 per year.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic with a minimum score of 47, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 90, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit an application for undergraduate admission and a non-refundable $25 application fee. You must also submit an official high school transcript. MTSU uses a holistic review for all freshman applicants. The primary criteria for admission are high school GPA and ACT/SAT score (optional for most). The academic rigor of high school courses and other information provided in your application may also be considered.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: Journalism is a field that offers many different paths for you to pursue your dreams. At MTSU, the Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Journalism will prepare you for a variety of careers in the changing media landscape. The Media Studies Concentration prepares students for a variety of entry-level positions in areas such as social media, public relations, content creation, brand management, event management, and corporate communications.

EnglishScore: For international undergraduate admission, applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted methods include official test scores from one of the following: TOEFL (70 internet-based or 525 paper-based), IELTS (6.0), PTE (48), Duolingo (100), or completion of ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements:
