To apply for undergraduate admission to the university, applicants need a completed application, a nonrefundable $25 application fee, and an official high school transcript. MTSU has a test-optional policy, so ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission consideration.

For admission specifically into the Journalism major, students must first be admitted to the university. After matriculating, they must complete at least 15 semester hours with a minimum 2.25 GPA and successfully complete JOUR 2710 with a grade of C- or better.
Department: School of Journalism and Strategic Media
Description: The sports media concentration within the Journalism program helps students prepare for careers in an expanding and ever-changing field. Students learn skills needed to report and write about sports and produce sports-related content across various media platforms. Courses focus on the history, ethics, and legal issues of sports media as well as news writing and reporting, feature writing, sports broadcasting, sports public relations, social media, and sports photography. Internships provide practical, real-world experience. Graduates are prepared for careers in journalism, broadcasting, social media, public relations, and content creation for various sports organizations.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC)
CostPerCredit: In-State: $416/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1208/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships for freshmen range from $2,000 to $5,000 per year.

EnglishScore: International applicants must meet English proficiency requirements. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 61, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, Duolingo English Test 95, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: This program prepares students for careers in criminal justice organizations at the federal, state, and local levels of government and within the private sector. This bachelor of science degree is unique because it combines rigorous academic instruction with internship opportunities and hands-on laboratory experiences to create an immersive, practical learning environment. Graduates of the Law Enforcement program will possess the necessary academic background, critical thinking skills, and practical experience to successfully transition into a variety of criminal justice fields or pursue graduate studies in related areas. The Law Enforcement, B.S. program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the theories, principles, and practices of law enforcement. Graduates will be prepared for a wide array of career opportunities in the field of law enforcement and will be prepared to assume leadership roles in criminal justice organizations. Students will gain knowledge and skills in areas such as criminal investigation, forensic science, homeland security, law enforcement administration, and criminal justice policy.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (Internet-based), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE score of 53, a minimum Duolingo score of 100, or completion of ELS Language Center level 112.
Requirements: All freshman applicants must submit the following: A completed application for undergraduate admission. A $25 nonrefundable application fee. An official high school transcript that shows a minimum of 16 college preparatory units. Official ACT or SAT scores may be submitted but are not required for admission.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Leisure and Sport Management, B.S. prepares students for leadership roles in a wide range of professional settings related to leisure and sport. This includes areas such as sport organizations, recreation facilities, community recreation, tourism, outdoor adventure, and private clubs. The program emphasizes management, marketing, finance, and legal aspects within the leisure and sport industries. Students will develop skills in planning, organizing, leading, and evaluating programs and services, as well as understanding the economic and social impact of leisure and sport. Through a combination of coursework, practical experience, and internship opportunities, graduates will be well-prepared to manage operations, develop programs, and provide exceptional experiences for diverse populations.

EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 61 or PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 48, or Duolingo 95. Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements: Admission to the Jones College of Business is required. In addition to the University’s guaranteed admission requirements, the Jones College has its own admission requirements. Students must have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA (this includes transfer work), and must have completed all lower-division business courses: ACCT 2110 and 2120, ECON 2410 and 2420, BIA 2610, and either MATH 1630 or 1810. (Student must have a grade of C or better in all.) Students must also have completed their freshman English composition sequence (ENGL 1010 and 1020) and MATH 1630 or higher. (Grade of C or better.)
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: Our management majors study how to plan, organize, lead, and control human, financial, and physical resources, whether they are in business, governmental or not-for-profit organizations. Students gain skills in all areas of management with an emphasis on communication, analysis, and problem-solving through both classroom and experiential learning. The program prepares students to become successful managers in a variety of organizations and industries. The Management program offers concentrations in Supply Chain Management and Business Administration.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International, the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Management, Human Resource Management Concentration, B.B.A.
EnglishScore: International students for whom English is not their native language must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum Scores: TOEFL- 71 (IBT), 525 (PBT); IELTS- 6.0; PTE- 53; Duolingo- 100; ELS Language Center- Completion of Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is based on a review of a student’s total high school performance as demonstrated by grades, test scores, and other supporting information. MTSU uses a 4.0 scale. Please see undergraduate admissions for more information. For assured admission, applicants must meet one of the following: 3.0 GPA; OR. 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or SAT of 1020; OR. a GPA of 2.5 with a 22 ACT or 1090 SAT. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed through our holistic review process. MTSU will consider other factors for admission, such as high school course work, academic letters of recommendation, and special circumstances as demonstrated in a personal statement.
Department: Jones College of Business
Description: This concentration prepares students for entry-level professional positions and careers in the human resource management profession. Students will be exposed to topics such as human resource planning, recruitment, selection, training and development, performance management, compensation and benefits, employee relations, and employment law. This concentration provides a strong foundation for students interested in pursuing professional certifications (e.g., SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, SPHR) and/or graduate studies in human resource management.
Accredidation: The Jones College of Business is accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $392/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,154/credit hour (based on 2023-2024 rates)
ScholarshipAmount: $1,000 - $5,000 per year, with full-tuition awards also available

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores include TOEFL iBT: 71, IELTS: 6.0, PTE Academic: 48, or Duolingo English Test: 95.
Requirements: General requirements for admission include submitting an online application, paying a nonrefundable application fee, and providing official transcripts. For first-time freshmen, an official high school transcript is required. For graduate applicants, official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities are required. MTSU is a test-optional university for undergraduate admission; applicants may submit ACT/SAT scores, but they are not required for an admission decision.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: Marketing majors learn to identify and analyze market needs, communicate product benefits, develop effective sales strategies, and manage customer relationships. Students develop a fundamental understanding of consumer behavior, marketing research, professional selling, marketing analytics, supply chain management, advertising, and international marketing. In addition to the general marketing curriculum, students can specialize in Professional Selling or Advertising. The faculty is a diverse group of highly-qualified educators with experience and expertise across various fields of marketing. Many of the faculty have international experience and all have terminal degrees from reputable universities. This expertise provides a rich learning environment for students in this ever-changing business world.
Accredidation: MTSU's Jones College of Business is among the top 1.5% of business schools worldwide to be accredited by AACSB International.

EnglishScore: MTSU requires proof of English language proficiency for admission. This can be fulfilled through various tests including TOEFL (iBT minimum 61, PBT minimum 500), IELTS (minimum 5.5), PTE Academic (minimum 45), Duolingo (minimum 95), or completion of ELS Level 109. Other exemptions may apply.
Requirements: Admission to MTSU is based upon a review of the high school record and test scores (ACT or SAT). The specific requirements are determined by the applicant’s high school grade point average (GPA). For more information about admission to MTSU, visit the Undergraduate Admissions website.
Department: Jones College of Business
Description: In the MTSU Marketing Digital Marketing concentration, you'll delve into the strategies and tactics essential for success in today's digital landscape. This program is tailored for students eager to specialize in the dynamic world of online marketing, covering everything from search engine optimization (SEO) and social media marketing to content strategy and analytics. As a student in this program, you will develop key skills in: * Crafting engaging digital content * Analyzing marketing data to inform decisions * Managing social media campaigns * Optimizing online presence for maximum impact * Understanding consumer behavior in digital environments
Accredidation: AACSB International accreditation

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all international applicants. This can be met by providing an official score report for one of the following: TOEFL (iBT 61, PBT 500), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), ELS Language Center (Level 112), Michigan Test (MET 55).
Requirements: Students who graduate from high school will be automatically admitted to MTSU if they have a 3.0 GPA. Those who have a GPA of less than 3.0 will be reviewed for admission based on their GPA and ACT/SAT test scores. Final admission for all students requires: High school diploma with a final GPA, or GED with a minimum score of 450, or HiSET with a minimum score of 45.
Department: Jennings A. Jones College of Business
Description: In today's global economy, marketing is essential for any business and requires qualified professionals trained in various aspects of the discipline. The Department of Marketing offers the Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.) in Marketing with concentrations in General Marketing, Professional Selling, and Digital Marketing. The Professional Selling concentration prepares students for careers in sales, sales management, and business-to-business marketing, among others. Students learn about the various stages of the selling process, managing a sales force, and how to effectively communicate and negotiate with customers. Graduates are well-prepared for entry-level sales positions or for advanced study in related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Guaranteed scholarships range from $2,000 to $3,500 per year; competitive scholarships can provide up to a full tuition waiver or $8,000 per year.

ProgramName: Mathematical Sciences, Actuarial Science Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by submitting one of the following: a TOEFL score of 61 (iBT) or 500 (PBT), an IELTS score of 5.5, a PTE score of 48, a Duolingo score of 95, or completion of ELS Level 109.
Requirements: Regular admission to the University requires a final high school GPA of 3.0 or higher OR a 2.7–2.99 GPA and a 19 ACT (990 SAT) OR a 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite regardless of GPA. MTSU will use a holistic review process for students who do not have an ACT or SAT score to provide. We will utilize a variety of factors to determine an admission decision, including but not limited to, high school courses, grades in those courses, and letters of recommendation.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences

EnglishScore: All students from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing proof of one of the following: a minimum score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (Internet-based) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); a minimum score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); a minimum score of 53 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 100 on the Duolingo English Test; completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center.
Requirements: To be considered for guaranteed admission, you need to meet the following criteria: GPA: 2.7 or higher AND ACT: 22 composite or higher (or SAT equivalent). If you have a GPA of 3.5 or higher, ACT/SAT scores are not required for an admission decision. If your GPA is below a 2.7, we will look at other factors like your ACT/SAT score, high school courses, and other items submitted with your application to make a holistic admission decision.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: MTSU's Mathematics B.S. degree is offered with four concentrations: Actuarial Science, Data Science, Mathematics, and Secondary Education. The Mathematics Concentration is for students who want to build a solid foundation in mathematics while preparing for graduate school or careers in a wide array of fields requiring strong analytical skills. You will take courses in discrete mathematics, modern algebra, calculus, and mathematical statistics, among others, to give you a deep understanding of mathematical theory and its applications. Potential career paths include statistics, operations research, data analysis, and many others.

ProgramName: Mathematical Sciences, Mathematics Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. A minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL (pBT), 61 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT), 5.5 on the IELTS, 95 on the Duolingo English Test, or 47 on the PTE Academic is required. Completion of ELS Language Centers level 112 also satisfies this requirement.
Requirements: Initial admission to the university requires applicants to meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 GPA or higher, OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1020. For formal admission into the Teacher Education Program, which is required to take upper-division education courses for this concentration, candidates must have a minimum 2.80 cumulative GPA, completion of specific foundational courses with a grade of 'C' or better, and either a composite score of 21 or higher on the ACT (or 1020 or higher on the SAT) OR passing scores on the Praxis CORE Academic Skills for Educators tests.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The B.S. in Mathematical Sciences with a concentration in Mathematics Teacher Licensure prepares students for careers as secondary mathematics teachers. Students completing the program will meet all requirements for a secondary mathematics teaching license in Tennessee (grades 6-12). The program includes course work in the major areas of mathematics (calculus, linear algebra, abstract algebra, geometry, probability and statistics, modeling) as well as professional education courses. Students will have multiple opportunities to observe and participate in classroom activities at the secondary level prior to a full semester of student teaching.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (54), Duolingo (105), or completion of ELS Level 112. Other conditions may also satisfy the requirement.
Requirements:
Admission to MTSU is a separate process from admission to a major. Students should consult the Undergraduate Catalog for University admission requirements. Following admission to the University, students desiring a major in mathematical sciences must meet the specific requirements of the Department of Mathematical Sciences.

To be admitted to the mathematical sciences major, a student must have completed at least 30 semester hours with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.00 and have completed MATH 1910 with a grade of C (2.00) or better.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The B.S. in Mathematical Sciences provides students with a strong foundational knowledge in a broad range of mathematical topics. The Statistics concentration focuses on probabilistic, statistical and mathematical modeling techniques. Graduates are prepared for a variety of careers in industry and government and for graduate study in mathematics or statistics.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate international applicants must submit one of the following to prove English proficiency: TOEFL score of 525 (paper-based) or 71 (internet-based), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112-English for Academic Purposes course.
Requirements: All students wishing to major or minor in music at MTSU must complete two applications: one for admission to the university and one to the School of Music. An audition for the School of Music faculty is also required. The School of Music application also serves as audition registration.
Department: School of Music
Concentration: Commercial Music, Music Education, Music Industry, Performance, Theory/Composition, Jazz Studies
Description:
The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) degree is designed for students who desire to pursue professional careers as musicians and for those who wish to continue their education at the graduate level.

B.M. Commercial Music: The Commercial Music Program is designed for students seeking careers in music performance, songwriting, audio engineering, and music production. Students gain hands-on experience through studio recording, live sound reinforcement, and audio post-production projects. The program emphasizes improvisation, composition, and technology, preparing students for the evolving demands of the music industry. Graduates are equipped for roles as performers, composers, producers, and audio engineers.

B.M. Music Education: The Music Education Program prepares students to become certified music teachers in K-12 public and private school settings. The curriculum combines extensive musical training with pedagogical instruction, field experiences, and student teaching placements. Students develop proficiency in instrumental and vocal performance, conducting, music theory, and music history, along with effective teaching methodologies. Graduates are eligible for Tennessee state licensure and are prepared to foster musical growth in young learners.

B.M. Music Industry: The Music Industry Program offers a comprehensive education in the business aspects of music. Students explore areas such as artist management, record label operations, music publishing, live entertainment, and digital music marketing. The curriculum integrates business principles with practical industry experience through internships and hands-on projects. Graduates are prepared for diverse roles in the music business, including artist managers, marketing specialists, music publishers, and venue operators.

B.M. Performance: The Performance Program focuses on developing advanced musical skills and artistry for students aspiring to professional performance careers. Students receive intensive private instruction on their primary instrument or voice, participate in a variety of ensembles, and engage in solo recitals. The curriculum covers advanced music theory, history, and repertoire, fostering comprehensive musicianship. Graduates are prepared for careers as professional performers, ensemble musicians, or for advanced graduate studies in performance.

B.M. Theory/Composition: The Theory/Composition Program is designed for students with a passion for creating and analyzing music. Students engage in rigorous study of advanced music theory, counterpoint, orchestration, and various compositional techniques. They have opportunities to compose original works for diverse ensembles and have their compositions performed. The program fosters critical listening, analytical thinking, and creative expression. Graduates are prepared for careers as composers, arrangers, theorists, or for graduate studies in music theory and composition.

B.M. Jazz Studies: The Jazz Studies Program provides specialized training in jazz performance, improvisation, theory, and history. Students receive private instruction on their instrument, participate in jazz ensembles, and develop skills in jazz arranging and composition. The curriculum emphasizes improvisational techniques, jazz harmony, and an understanding of the historical and cultural context of jazz. Graduates are prepared for careers as jazz performers, educators, arrangers, or for further specialized study in jazz.
Accredidation: MTSU is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM). All music degree programs are accredited by NASM.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be done by meeting the minimum score on one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT: 71; TOEFL PBT: 525; IELTS: 6.0; PTE: 48; Duolingo: 95; or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Students intending to major in music must first be admitted to the university, then must audition for the School of Music faculty. Admission to the university does not guarantee admission to the School of Music. The audition for the Commercial Songwriting concentration consists of two parts: a portfolio submission and a live audition/interview. The portfolio requires two original songs (audio recording and lyric sheet for each) and a short video introduction. The live audition includes a performance of one original song, a demonstration of music theory fundamentals, and an interview.
Department: School of Music
Description: The Recording Industry Department offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Recording Industry with three concentrations: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business. This particular page describes the Commercial Songwriting concentration. This program is for students who want to develop their skills in writing songs for a variety of commercial music applications, including pop, country, R&B, and film/TV. Students will learn the craft of songwriting, music theory, audio production techniques, and business aspects of the music industry. The curriculum focuses on developing creative and technical skills necessary to succeed as a professional songwriter, including collaboration, demo production, and copyright. Graduates are prepared for careers as staff songwriters, artists who write their own material, composers for film/TV, and other roles in the creative side of the music industry.
CostPerCredit: In-state: ~$419/credit hour; Out-of-state: ~$1,177/credit hour (based on 2024-2025 tuition and mandatory fees)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $7,000/year for guaranteed academic scholarships.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 71 (iBT) or 525 (PBT), a minimum IELTS score of 6.0, a minimum PTE Academic score of 48, a minimum Duolingo score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Language Center level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Music Business program is separate from admission to the University. To be admitted to the music business concentration, a student must meet the general admission requirements of MTSU and successfully complete an audition on a principal instrument/voice for the School of Music faculty. Audition registration is online through the School of Music.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: The Music Business concentration (B.S.) combines coursework in the Recording Industry Department with a full music minor in the School of Music, and is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in the history, theory, and business of music while also allowing flexibility for students to pursue a wide range of career interests. This includes careers in artist management, concert promotion, music publishing, entrepreneurship, live sound, studio recording, and more. A minor in Music is required with this major.
Accredidation: MTSU is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Proof of English proficiency can be demonstrated by one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 61, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 5.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic overall score of 50, Duolingo English Test minimum score of 95, Successful completion of the ELS Language Center’s intensive program level 112, or other approved methods.
Requirements: Admission to the School of Music is by audition for all music majors and minors. All prospective students who wish to be accepted as music majors or minors must successfully complete an audition on their principal instrument/voice. Prospective majors must apply to the University as music-intended majors prior to their School of Music audition. Students admitted to the B.M. in Music Industry must meet a secondary admission standard to be fully admitted to this competitive program. In order to become a candidate for the B.M. in Music Industry, a student must apply and be admitted to MTSU, declaring Music Industry as a major; and audition and be accepted for applied study at the 2000-level on a principal instrument or voice in the School of Music. Upon completion of the above, a student may seek candidacy status by completing an online candidacy application. To be considered for candidacy, a student must have a minimum 2.50 overall GPA and have completed RIM 1020 and MUS 1120 with a grade of C (2.0) or better. The candidacy application deadline is May 15.
Department: School of Music
Description: Music industry is one of the largest employers of musicians and those interested in a creative path. Music industry professionals can be found in publishing, recording, concert production, artist management, marketing, sound engineering, retailing, and instrument manufacturing, to name a few of the many career options. They work as songwriters, performers, producers, arrangers, agents, attorneys, publicists, retailers, and entrepreneurs in a competitive but rewarding environment. Our program, located in a national hub of the music business, provides the skills and experience you will need to succeed.
Accredidation: The MTSU School of Music is an institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM) and is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC).

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency through one of several options, including a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 70, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 53, or Duolingo English Test score of 100. Completion of ELS Language Centers Intensive Program level 112 is also an option, among other exemptions.
Requirements: In addition to university admission requirements, all students seeking a major in music must pass an audition. The audition determines a student's eligibility for admission to the School of Music and allows the student to be considered for a music scholarship. For specific information about audition dates and procedures, contact the School of Music (615) 898-2469 or visit the website.
Department: School of Music
Concentration: Instrumental Performance Concentration (Brass, Orchestral Strings, Woodwinds, and Percussion)
Description: The B.M. in Instrumental Performance with a concentration in Brass, Orchestral Strings, Woodwinds, and Percussion provides students with a high level of training needed for careers as performing artists, studio musicians, and teachers. The comprehensive curriculum allows students to gain the skills needed to pursue careers as performers, educators, and leaders in the field of music. Along with private lessons, students will gain experience through instrumental ensembles and chamber music. The curriculum also includes coursework in music theory, history, and keyboard skills. Additionally, students will develop musicianship skills in ear training, sight-singing, and improvisation.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate applicants must provide one of the following to meet MTSU’s English proficiency requirement.
Requirements: All prospective music majors must successfully pass an audition for full acceptance into the MTSU School of Music. Acceptance to the university does not guarantee acceptance into the School of Music. Acceptance into the School of Music does not guarantee acceptance into the university. This is in addition to meeting the general university admission requirements.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a concentration in Music Studies is a non-performance degree designed to provide students with a broad background in music. This concentration is ideal for students who wish to pursue graduate study in musicology, music theory, composition, or other academic areas of music. It is also suitable for students interested in careers in arts administration, music criticism, or other music-related fields that do not require extensive performance training. The curriculum emphasizes a strong foundation in music theory, music history, and musicianship, along with opportunities for elective studies in areas such as composition, conducting, and world music.
Accredidation: The School of Music at Middle Tennessee State University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM). All music degree programs are approved by NASM. This accreditation ensures that our programs meet national standards for quality music instruction and prepares students for successful careers in music.
ScholarshipAmount: Awards range from $500 to $5,000 per year

ProgramName: Music, Music Theory and Composition Concentration, B.M.
EnglishScore: For international applicants, proof of English proficiency can be demonstrated by one of the following: TOEFL (71 iBT, 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo English Test (95), ELS Language Center (Level 112), ACT English subscore of 19, or SAT Reading Test subscore of 25. Conditional admission is available for students who do not meet these requirements.
Requirements:
All prospective students must first be admitted to the University before they can be officially admitted to the School of Music. All undergraduate students wishing to major in music must successfully complete an audition on their principal instrument and an interview with the faculty in their chosen area.

For the Music, Music Theory and Composition Concentration, B.M., applicants must:
1.  Submit a portfolio of at least three original compositions and/or arrangements. The scores should demonstrate a basic knowledge of music notation and an understanding of instrumental and/or vocal writing.
2.  Participate in a brief interview with the composition faculty.
3.  Perform one or two short, contrasting pieces on their major instrument or voice.

All entering undergraduate music majors are also required to take a theory placement exam prior to their first semester of enrollment.
Department: School of Music
Description: The MTSU School of Music is proud to offer two degree programs for students interested in writing music: Music Theory & Composition and Commercial Songwriting. We believe that composers need to be versatile, so we teach a broad range of styles to prepare students for the variety of career paths available to them. This will include not only Western classical music but also jazz and popular music styles. As a student in the Music Theory & Composition program, you will develop your skills in traditional and contemporary techniques of composition, score reading, sight-singing, and ear training. You will receive private lessons on your primary instrument and in composition, study counterpoint and form and analysis, and attend seminars on composition. There are also frequent opportunities for you to hear your works performed by fellow students or by faculty members. In addition, all students participate in recitals, workshops, and other performances both on and off campus. Graduates of the program are well prepared for careers as composers and arrangers in the classical, popular, and commercial music fields. They also pursue graduate studies in composition or music theory.
Accredidation: The MTSU School of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include a TOEFL score of 71 (Internet) or 525 (Paper), IELTS score of 6.0, PTE Academic score of 48, Duolingo score of 95, or successful completion of the ELS Language Center’s intensive program level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the University does not guarantee admission to the School of Music. All prospective music majors must complete the following in addition to applying for university admission:
1. Complete the online School of Music application.
2. Pass an audition/interview.
3. Take the Music Theory Placement Exam.
Information about auditions and the Theory Placement Exam can be found on the School of Music website.
Department: School of Music
Description: At MTSU, instrumental performance majors have the opportunity to study with outstanding artist-teachers in state-of-the-art facilities. Graduates go on to successful careers as performers, educators, and administrators, and many continue their studies in graduate school. With the largest college of music in Tennessee and one of the finest in the Southeast, MTSU is the perfect place to hone your musical skills. Students may major in piano, organ, voice, guitar, orchestral strings, brass, woodwinds, or percussion. The Bachelor of Music degree with a concentration in Instrumental Performance provides intensive study in a student's major performing medium and related fields. Courses in theory, history, and ensemble provide the necessary background to develop comprehensive musicianship. Many performance opportunities are available in MTSU’s numerous performing ensembles, including orchestral, band, jazz, chamber, and opera/music theatre productions.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $318/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1078/credit hour (Maintenance Fee only, additional fees apply)

Requirements: In addition to applying to the University, all prospective undergraduate music majors and minors MUST also complete the supplemental School of Music Application and audition for the music faculty. Acceptance into the School of Music is contingent upon acceptance into the University.
Department: School of Music
Fees: The annual tuition and mandatory fees for a full-time undergraduate student for 2023-2024 are $10,060 for Tennessee residents and $29,164 for out-of-state students. An additional Applied Music Fee of $75 per semester hour of credit (capped at $150 per semester) may apply.
Description: The Bachelor of Music (B.M.) in Music with a concentration in Theatre is a professional degree for students who intend to pursue careers in music theatre or who intend to pursue graduate studies in music theatre, vocal performance, or theatre. With a focus on both vocal and dramatic training, the program provides students with a strong foundation in music theory, history, and performance, as well as acting, dance, and stagecraft. Students gain experience in a variety of performance settings through opportunities in MTSU’s opera, musical theatre, and play productions, as well as solo and ensemble performances.
Accredidation: The School of Music is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
CostPerCredit: In-State: $323/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1119/credit hour (tuition only, additional fees apply)
ScholarshipAmount: University-wide scholarships available up to $5,000 per year. School of Music scholarships range from partial fee waivers to full tuition.

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official score report for one of the following exams: TOEFL (71 iBT / 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (51), Duolingo (100), or ELS Language Centers (Level 112).
Requirements:
To be considered for admission into the B.S.N. program, students must meet the following criteria:
1. Be fully admitted to MTSU in good standing or be eligible for readmission.
2. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 (4.0 scale). The cumulative GPA is calculated using all attempted college coursework from all institutions attended.
3. Minimum GPA of 3.0 in required science courses (BIOL 2010/2011, BIOL 2020/2021, BIOL 2230/2231, and CHEM 1030/1031 or higher). Science courses taken more than 5 years prior to application must be repeated.
4. Completion of all but 16 hours of University general education and nursing prerequisite course requirements.
5. Completion of the HESI A2 exam with a minimum cumulative score of 75%. The HESI A2 exam may only be taken one time per admission cycle.
6. A completed online School of Nursing application submitted through NursingCAS by the application deadline.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences, School of Nursing
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) is a professional nursing program designed to prepare generalist nurses to practice in a variety of settings and to provide a foundation for graduate study. Graduates are eligible to apply to take the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEX-RN) for licensure as a Registered Nurse. The School of Nursing is committed to providing quality educational opportunities to a diverse student body, fostering professional growth and development, and preparing graduates to meet the current and future healthcare needs of the community. In addition to gaining expertise in the classroom, students receive extensive clinical experience in a wide variety of healthcare settings.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing at Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met through one of the following methods: TOEFL score of 525 (paper-based), 195 (computer-based), or 71 (internet-based); IELTS score of 6; PTE Academic score of 53; Duolingo English Test score of 100; completion of the ELS Language Center’s intensive program level 112; or completion of English Composition I and II with a grade of C or better from a U.S. college or university. Students from certain English-speaking countries may be exempt.
Requirements: Guaranteed Admission: Option 1: 3.0 GPA or higher. Option 2: 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or higher (or SAT of 1020 or higher). Holistic Review: For applicants who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements, MTSU also has a holistic review process. In addition to GPA and test scores, we will consider up to 14 other factors, including the rigor of high school courses, letters of recommendation, and an applicant’s demonstrated commitment to service and leadership.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Concentration: Social and Political Philosophy OR Logic and the Philosophy of Science
Description: A bachelor's degree in Philosophy provides a solid foundation for careers in law, government, business, journalism, and more. Critical thinking, strong communication skills, and the ability to analyze complex arguments are some of the hallmarks of a good philosophy program and the skills that employers demand from college graduates. MTSU's Department of Philosophy and Religious Studies is recognized for its excellence in teaching and research, and faculty are dedicated to providing a rigorous and rewarding educational experience for students. Students can choose between two areas of emphasis in their Philosophy B.A.: Social and Political Philosophy OR Logic and the Philosophy of Science.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, with guaranteed academic scholarships ranging from $3,500 to $5,000 per year.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all students whose native language is not English. Any one of the following is acceptable: TOEFL (minimum 71 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum 53), Duolingo (minimum 100), or completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements:
To be guaranteed admission to MTSU, you must meet one of the following:
3.0 GPA
OR 2.7 GPA and 19 ACT (or 990 SAT)
OR 2.5 GPA and 21 ACT (or 1060 SAT)
OR Minimum 22 ACT (or 1100 SAT)
ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission for students with a 3.0+ high school GPA. A test score will be required for HOPE Scholarship eligibility.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Physics, Applied Physics Concentration, B.S. will provide students with the ability to integrate physics principles with their applications and to develop solutions to real-world problems. This concentration provides a solid foundation for students planning careers in industry or government research facilities, or who intend to pursue graduate studies in physics or engineering. Physics is an exciting field, fundamental to all the sciences, encompassing the study of nature at its most basic level, from the elementary particles that make up matter to the large-scale structure of the universe. Studying physics helps students develop critical thinking and quantitative reasoning skills that are valuable in a wide range of careers.
CostPerCredit: In-state: $320/credit hour (tuition only); Out-of-state: $1076/credit hour (tuition only)

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores are TOEFL iBT 61, IELTS 5.5, PTE 48, or Duolingo 95. Successful completion of ELS Level 112 also meets the requirement.
Requirements:
To be eligible for guaranteed admission, you must meet one of the following:
3.5+ high school GPA
OR
3.0+ high school GPA AND 22+ ACT (1100+ SAT)
OR
Less than 3.0 high school GPA AND 25+ ACT (1200+ SAT)
(All GPAs are based on a 4.0 scale.)
Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through a holistic review. MTSU will review each student holistically, considering the following: High school GPA, ACT/SAT score, Academic rigor, Essay, and Letters of Recommendation.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, from $2,000/year to full tuition waiver

EnglishScore: Proficiency in English must be demonstrated through one of the following before a student can be considered for full admission to an academic program: TOEFL (a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 71 on the internet-based test (iBT)); IELTS (a minimum score of 6.0); PTE Academic (a minimum score of 48); Duolingo English Test (a minimum score of 95); ELS (Completion of level 112 at an ELS Language Center).
Requirements: MTSU offers guaranteed admission for first-time freshmen who have completed the recommended high school curriculum and meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 high school GPA with a 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT) or higher, OR a 3.5 high school GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score. MTSU is a test-optional university, and applicants who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for a holistic admission decision.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Physics, B.S. with a Physics Teaching concentration is designed to produce highly qualified graduates in Physics who are eligible to be licensed to teach high school Physics. The curriculum meets the requirements set forth by the Tennessee Department of Education for licensure in Physics (grades 9-12). All students complete the same core courses in physics including Mechanics, Electricity and Magnetism, Optics, Modern Physics, and Quantum Mechanics. Students also complete courses in mathematics through Differential Equations. The Physics Teaching concentration also provides courses in pedagogy and methods of teaching Physics through the Department of Education. Graduates of this concentration are also prepared to enter graduate school in Physics, Engineering, or other related fields.

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency for admission to the university. This can be done by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo English Test (95), or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.
Requirements: MTSU will use either ACT or SAT scores along with high school GPA for admission decisions. Assured Admission requires a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite of 22 (or 1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. Students who apply with a 3.0 GPA or higher will not be required to submit a test score for an admission decision.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Physics offers a comprehensive study of physics through a combination of traditional classroom instruction and hands-on laboratory experience. Students learn through experimentation, observation, and measurement while developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills necessary to succeed in a wide range of career paths or graduate studies. The program covers mechanics, electricity and magnetism, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics. In addition, students gain proficiency in experimental design, data analysis, and scientific communication. Students in the Professional Physics Concentration will learn: Fundamental principles of physics, including mechanics, electricity and magnetism, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics; Experimental design, data analysis, and scientific communication; Critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills; The applications of physics to various fields, such as engineering, medicine, and research. The curriculum provides a strong foundation for students pursuing careers in physics, engineering, or related fields, as well as those planning to attend graduate school.

ProgramName: Physics, Quantum Science and Computing Concentration, B.S.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description:
This concentration in the Physics B.S. degree program prepares students for graduate studies and careers in quantum science and engineering. This includes quantum computing, quantum information, quantum sensing, quantum imaging, quantum communication, and other emerging quantum technologies. It also provides a strong foundation for a variety of careers in other STEM fields.
The curriculum focuses on the theoretical and experimental foundations of quantum mechanics, quantum computing, quantum information, and quantum materials. Students will develop skills in quantum programming, laboratory techniques, and scientific communication. Through a combination of coursework, research opportunities, and hands-on projects, students will gain a deep understanding of the principles and applications of quantum science and computing.

Requirements: Assured admission for first-time freshmen is based on a combination of your high school GPA and ACT/SAT scores. You will be admitted if you have: A 3.0 GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score (if provided) OR A minimum 2.7 GPA and a 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite score.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Students majoring in Plant and Soil Science at MTSU develop expertise in the fundamental principles of plant growth, soil management, and sustainable agricultural practices. This program prepares students for a wide array of career opportunities in agriculture, environmental science, and related industries. Through a blend of rigorous coursework, hands-on laboratory experiences, and fieldwork, students gain practical skills and theoretical knowledge essential for addressing contemporary challenges in food production, resource management, and environmental sustainability. The curriculum covers areas such as crop science, soil fertility, plant pathology, entomology, horticulture, and environmental regulations, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of the plant and soil ecosystems.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency.
Requirements:
MTSU offers guaranteed admission to students who meet one of the following academic criteria:

- 2.7 high school GPA or higher
- 22 ACT composite or higher
- 1100 SAT or higher

Students who have a 3.0 GPA or higher can apply for admission without submitting ACT or SAT scores.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: Political Science is the systematic study of political systems, governments, and politics. In an age of increasing globalization and interdependence, a thorough grounding in Political Science and its related disciplines is vital for citizens to understand the issues they face and the choices they make. Such an understanding is also vital for students who intend to pursue careers in the legal profession, public service (local, state, national, and international), interest groups, journalism, business, education, campaign management, or public policy analysis. Our program is designed to provide students with comprehensive knowledge in Political Science as well as develop skills in critical thinking, writing, research, and oral communication. We are committed to an educational experience that cultivates active and ethical citizenship. Students may choose a general Political Science curriculum or specialize in one of three concentrations: Pre-Law, Public Administration, and International Relations. A Political Science minor is also available.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Health Administration Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency by submitting a satisfactory score on the TOEFL (71 iBT/525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
For University Admission (First-Time Freshmen): Assured Admission requires a 3.0 GPA OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. For the Fall 2024 and Spring 2025 terms, first-time freshmen may be admitted to MTSU without a test score (ACT/SAT).

For Admission to the Major: Once a student has been admitted to the University, he/she may be admitted to the major upon reaching a total of 30 hours of college credit with a minimum GPA of 2.0.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies with a concentration in Health Administration is designed for individuals with a two-year technical or occupational degree who want to advance into leadership and supervisory roles in healthcare. This program will provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to pursue administrative positions in hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and other healthcare organizations. With a solid foundation in the principles of management, finance, marketing, human resources, and healthcare policy, graduates will be well-prepared to address the complex challenges facing today's healthcare industry. The curriculum focuses on developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills, ensuring that students are equipped to effectively lead and manage healthcare teams and organizations. In addition, the program offers flexibility through online course delivery, allowing students to balance their academic pursuits with their professional and personal commitments.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Information Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for students from non-English speaking countries. Accepted proofs include: TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Professional Studies major requires a minimum of 60 earned hours and a 2.0 GPA. For university admission requirements, please visit the Undergraduate Admissions website.
Department: University College
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Professional Studies with a concentration in Information Technology prepares students for various information technology roles. This program is designed for students who have prior learning from professional, military, or technical sources. The curriculum balances general education with core courses in professional studies and specialized courses in information technology. Students will gain skills in areas such as networking, cybersecurity, database management, and software development, essential for today's dynamic IT landscape. Graduates will be equipped to apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to real-world IT challenges, advancing their careers or pursuing further education.

ProgramName: Professional Studies, International Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Students from some English-speaking countries may be exempt. Official test scores must be submitted directly from the testing agency to MTSU. MTSU's school code is 1466. Acceptable tests and scores include TOEFL (500 PBT or 61 iBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (85), or completion of ELS level 109.
Requirements: Admission to the B.S. in Professional Studies requires an associate’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, 60 or more college credits from a regionally accredited institution, or military credits evaluated for college credit. A GPA of at least 2.0 is required.
Department: University College
ScholarshipPercentage: Nearly 80% of students receive financial assistance

ProgramName: Professional Studies, Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: MTSU requires all international students to demonstrate English proficiency. Proof of English proficiency may be submitted in one of the following ways: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 500 (PBT) or 61 (iBT). IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 5.5. PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 48. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95. Successful completion of ELS (English Language Services) Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to this program is not guaranteed. Admission will be determined at the time of advisement. Students must have a 2.0 GPA to be admitted.
Department: University College
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies provides students with a broad interdisciplinary education that combines both a professional core and a concentration of specialized knowledge. This degree is designed to meet the growing need for adult and nontraditional students to complete an undergraduate degree that will enhance their career opportunities. Each concentration provides students with the critical thinking, communication, and technological skills required to become leaders in a variety of fields and organizations. The Organizational Leadership concentration prepares students to be leaders by providing them with the necessary skills to effectively lead others, manage resources, and achieve organizational goals. Students gain a comprehensive understanding of leadership theories, organizational behavior, ethics, and strategic planning within a variety of organizational settings.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required for all international applicants. This requirement can be satisfied by submitting one of the following: a minimum TOEFL score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT), a minimum IELTS band score of 5.5, a minimum PTE Academic score of 47, a minimum Duolingo score of 95, or completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, you should have a minimum 3.0 GPA OR a minimum 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet these requirements can be reviewed for admission through a holistic review process. Holistic review factors include but are not limited to high school GPA, ACT/SAT scores, academic rigor, dual enrollment coursework, and non-cognitive factors.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Psychology at Middle Tennessee State University provides a comprehensive curriculum covering the breadth of psychology as a science and a profession. Students gain a foundational understanding of human thought, emotion, and behavior through core courses in research methods, statistics, and various subfields of psychology such as developmental, cognitive, social, and abnormal psychology. The program emphasizes critical thinking, scientific inquiry, and ethical considerations, preparing students for diverse career paths or advanced graduate studies. With a focus on empirical research and practical application, graduates are equipped with analytical skills valuable in many professional settings.

EnglishScore: International applicants from non-native English speaking countries must provide evidence of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include TOEFL iBT: 71, IELTS: 6.0, PTE Academic: 48, Duolingo: 95, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
Students who graduate from a state-approved high school will be automatically admitted to MTSU if they meet ONE of the following criteria:

3.0 GPA OR
22 ACT composite (1020 SAT) OR
2.7 GPA AND 19 ACT composite (900 SAT)
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description:
The Public Health program offers a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Public Health that provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to address complex health challenges at the local, national, and global levels. The curriculum emphasizes health promotion, disease prevention, and health equity, preparing graduates for careers in diverse public health settings.
This program offers two concentrations:
*   Community Health Education: Focuses on developing and implementing health education programs.
*   Health Administration: Focuses on the management and leadership aspects of public health organizations.

This program will prepare you for a variety of entry-level public health positions in local, state, and national governmental agencies; non-profit organizations; hospitals and clinics; and private businesses. Graduates are also prepared for graduate study in public health or related fields.

EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Official test scores cannot be more than two years old. Test scores must be sent directly to MTSU from the testing center.
Requirements: General university admission is required. Per the MTSU undergraduate admissions page, for assured admission, applicants need a 3.0+ GPA, or a 2.70-2.99 GPA with a 19 ACT composite (990 SAT total). MTSU is a test-optional institution. In addition, all Recording Industry majors must be admitted to candidacy before they can take upper-division (3000-4000 level) courses. To apply for candidacy, students must be admitted to MTSU, have a declared major in Recording Industry, have earned at least 45 semester hours, have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA, and have completed specific prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Concentration: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, Music Business
Description:
MTSU's Recording Industry program is considered one of the best and largest in the world. The department is a leader in developing cutting-edge curricula that prepare graduates for success in the dynamic and evolving media and entertainment industries. With programs in Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business, the Department of Recording Industry offers a solid foundation for anyone interested in making a career in the recording arts and sciences.

The Recording Industry B.S. program is a rigorous, professionally oriented course of study. Whether it is sound reinforcement for live performance, digital audio workstation skills for studio production, music publishing, or artist management, this comprehensive program gives students the opportunity to learn and develop skills in state-of-the-art facilities with award-winning faculty. Students also benefit from an active and engaged student body and a vast network of successful alumni.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Audio Production Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. This can be met by providing an acceptable score on the TOEFL (71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE Academic (48), Duolingo (95), or by completing ELS Level 112, among other options.
Requirements: All Recording Industry majors enter the university as pre-Recording Industry majors. Students must pass a candidacy review to be admitted into the program. To be eligible for the candidacy review, students must meet the following criteria: Have a minimum 2.0 overall GPA. Complete at least 30 credit hours. Pass the following courses with a grade of C or better: RIM 3000, RIM 3010, RIM 3600. Pass the Audio Production Candidacy Exam.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Recording Industry with a concentration in Audio Production prepares students for careers in the professional audio industries. The curriculum provides a balance between theoretical knowledge and practical applications in the areas of music production, sound reinforcement, and audio post-production. The program’s main emphasis is on the creative use of technology in the art of recorded and live sound. Students are trained in multi-track recording, mixing, mastering, and the use of current digital audio workstations (DAW). The curriculum focuses on critical listening, problem-solving, and developing a strong aesthetic for sound. The Audio Production concentration prepares students to work in commercial recording studios, post-production houses, live sound production companies, video game audio, and broadcast facilities.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Commercial Songwriting Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include TOEFL iBT: 61, IELTS: 5.5, PTE Academic: 46, Duolingo: 95. Completion of ELS Language Center Level 109 is also accepted. Other options and exemptions may be available.
Requirements: Admission to the Recording Industry, Commercial Songwriting concentration is selective. Students must pass a juried audition for consideration for acceptance. The songwriting jury will require submission of a portfolio including two original songs and a statement of purpose. An interview is also required.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Description: MTSU's Recording Industry program is widely recognized as one of the best in the world. Its alumni work in every facet of the industry, and its facilities offer cutting-edge technology and learning opportunities. The Commercial Songwriting concentration, a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree, provides a unique opportunity to study the art and craft of songwriting while simultaneously learning about the business of music. Students gain proficiency in music theory and performance while developing their own personal songwriting style. Topics such as copyright, publishing, and licensing are covered from an industry perspective. This program is offered in the College of Media and Entertainment. Upon completion of the B.S. in Recording Industry: Commercial Songwriting, students will be prepared for a career in music publishing, songwriting, or other aspects of the music business.

ProgramName: Recording Industry, Music Business Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) - 500 (paper-based) or 61 (internet-based); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) - 48; Duolingo - 95; Successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Recording Industry major is a two-step process. The first step is admission to the university. For freshman admission, applicants with a 3.0+ cumulative high school GPA are not required to submit an ACT/SAT score. Applicants with a high school GPA below 3.0 are required to submit a test score for review. An applicant with a 2.7 cumulative high school GPA requires a 20 ACT or a 1020 SAT composite score for admission consideration. The second step is admission to the major, which is competitive and determined by a candidacy review after enrollment. To be eligible for review, students must complete specific lower-division coursework with a grade of C or better and have an overall GPA of 2.5.
Department: College of Media and Entertainment
Fees: $10,760 per year (in-state, based on 2024-2025 rates for tuition and mandatory fees)
Description: MTSU’s Bachelor of Science in Recording Industry offers three concentrations: Audio Production, Commercial Songwriting, and Music Business. Each concentration provides a specialized course of study to prepare students for a variety of careers in the professional sound and music industries. Through hands-on experience and instruction from faculty who are also industry professionals, students gain the expertise needed for success. Housed in the College of Media and Entertainment, the department maintains seven state-of-the-art recording studios, including one of the finest live performance venues, two mixing labs, and a mastering lab, allowing students to develop and hone skills at a level consistent with professional standards. The department also operates an in-house record label, Match Records, and provides students with internship opportunities with area employers as well as Nashville’s music industry.
Accredidation: Middle Tennessee State University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, master’s, and doctor’s degrees. Programs in the College of Media and Entertainment are also accredited by the Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC).

EnglishScore: Applicants from non-native English speaking countries must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL (minimum score of 71 iBT or 525 PBT), IELTS (minimum score of 6.0), PTE Academic (minimum score of 48), Duolingo English Test (minimum score of 95), or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: MTSU assures admission to students with a 3.0 GPA OR students with a 2.7 GPA AND an ACT score of 22 (or SAT equivalent). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through our holistic review process.
Department: College of Liberal Arts
Description: The Religious Studies program at MTSU offers an interdisciplinary approach to the academic study of religion. Our curriculum is designed to introduce students to the diverse religious traditions of the world, explore the theoretical and methodological approaches to studying religion, and foster critical thinking skills regarding the role of religion in human societies past and present. Students will examine religious texts, practices, beliefs, and institutions from a global perspective, developing a nuanced understanding of their historical, cultural, and social contexts. Through our courses, students will cultivate analytical abilities, research skills, and an appreciation for cultural diversity. The program prepares students for a variety of career paths where an understanding of global cultures and critical inquiry is valued, including education, journalism, non-profit organizations, government, law, social services, and religious leadership. It also provides an excellent foundation for graduate studies in Religious Studies, Theology, History, Sociology, and other humanities and social science fields.

ProgramName: Science, Allied Health Science Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. MTSU accepts: TOEFL: 61 iBT / 500 PBT, IELTS: 5.5, PTE: 47, Duolingo: 95, ELS: Completion of ELS Language Center's Level 109.
Requirements: Admission to the University does not guarantee admission to this program. See a program advisor for details.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Fees: In-State: $4,887 per semester; Out-of-State: $14,139 per semester (based on 12+ credit hours for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
Description: The Bachelor of Science degree in Science with a concentration in Allied Health Science provides a solid foundation for students pursuing careers in allied health fields. This program is ideal for students who wish to apply to professional programs such as physical therapy, occupational therapy, physician assistant, chiropractic, or optometry. It can also prepare students for direct entry into some allied health professions.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $407.75 per credit hour; Out-of-State: $1,177.75 per credit hour (for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $4,887 per semester; Out-of-State: $14,139 per semester (based on 12+ credit hours for Fall 2023/Spring 2024)
ScholarshipAmount: Up to $6,000 per year for guaranteed freshman scholarships.

ProgramName: Science, Allied Health Technology Concentration, B.S.
EnglishScore: Provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based test (iBT); IELTS: Minimum score of 5.5; PTE: Minimum score of 44; Duolingo: Minimum score of 90; Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: All students must complete 16 core high school units to be considered for admission. In addition to the high school unit requirements, admission is based on high school grade point average (GPA) and test scores. MTSU provides assured admission to students who meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 GPA or higher (test-optional); a 2.7 GPA or higher with a 22 ACT or 1100 SAT or higher; or a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 with a 20 ACT or 1020 SAT or higher. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements may be considered through a holistic review process.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Fees: In-state: $9,321/year; Out-of-state: $28,713/year (based on 2024-2025 rates for full-time enrollment)
Description:
The B.S. in Science, Allied Health Technology Concentration, is an interdisciplinary degree developed in collaboration with area colleges of medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, and allied health to meet the academic preparation for students wishing to apply to professional schools in the allied health professions. Coursework emphasizes a strong background in the basic sciences in preparation for the rigorous demands of professional school curricula. Students completing this concentration will find it to be a unique path leading to various professional health careers.
This concentration is designed for students seeking entry into professional health programs such as dentistry, medicine, occupational therapy, optometry, pharmacy, physical therapy, physician’s assistant, and veterinary medicine. Students are encouraged to explore their options with the Pre-Professional Health Advising program early in their academic career.

EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. One of the following test scores or academic qualifications is required: TOEFL minimum score of 525 (paper-based), 195 (computer-based), or 71 (internet-based); IELTS minimum score of 6; PTE Academic minimum score of 53; Duolingo minimum score of 100; Completion of ELS Level 112; among other options.
Requirements: First-time freshmen who meet one of the following criteria are guaranteed admission to MTSU: 2.7 or higher cumulative high school GPA; An ACT composite score of 22 or higher OR a SAT total score of 1100 or higher (exam must be taken prior to March 2016 for SAT score); A redesigned SAT total score of 1130 or higher (exam taken March 2016 or after).
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: Middle Tennessee State University’s Science, General Science Concentration, B.S. provides students with a broad background in the sciences. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in biology, chemistry, and physics while offering flexibility for students to explore their interests. The General Science B.S. degree is ideal for students who want to develop a broad understanding of science, pursue a career in science education, or prepare for graduate studies in interdisciplinary fields. It also prepares students for careers in fields that require a strong understanding of scientific principles, such as technical writing, science communication, and public policy. The program can also serve as a strong foundation for students interested in a variety of pre-professional programs (Pre-med, Pre-dental, Pre-veterinary, Pre-pharmacy, etc.). The General Science B.S. concentration allows students to select 18 hours of science electives (biology, chemistry, or physics) to create an individualized program of study tailored to their career goals. Students in this program will learn to think critically, solve problems, and communicate effectively, all skills essential for success in a rapidly changing world.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $419/credit hour; Out-of-State: $1197/credit hour (based on 2023-24 rates)
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $9,716/year; Out-of-State: $29,360/year (based on 2023-24 rates for 15 credits/semester)
ScholarshipPercentage: 66% of full-time undergraduates received institutional grant/scholarship aid

ProgramName: Science, Medical School Early Acceptance Program (MSEAP), B.S.
Requirements:
A minimum high school GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale
A minimum ACT composite score of 25 (or SAT equivalent)
Demonstrate a commitment to a career in medicine.
Demonstrate a commitment to serving in a medically-underserved area.
Have a U.S. citizenship or be a U.S. permanent resident.
Meet the criteria as an underrepresented minority student.
Department: College of Basic and Applied Sciences
Description: The Medical School Early Acceptance Program (MSEAP) is designed for exceptional high school students who are highly motivated to pursue a career in medicine. Students selected for this program are conditionally admitted to Meharry Medical College (MMC) through a partnership between MTSU and MMC. MSEAP students are guaranteed admission to MMC upon successful completion of an MTSU Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree and MSEAP program requirements, including maintaining a minimum GPA and completing required coursework and experiences. The program aims to provide a clear pathway and strong support system for students committed to medical school, including specialized advising, mentorship, research opportunities, and clinical exposure.

EnglishScore: Undergraduate international applicants may be required to submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: TOEFL iBT 61, TOEFL PBT 500, IELTS 5.5, PTE Academic 47, Duolingo 95, or completion of ELS Level 112. Other exemptions are also available for those who qualify.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, a student must have completed SW 2210, 60 credit hours, a 2.50 overall GPA, and have passed the departmental writing requirement. A formal application will be submitted for competitive review by the faculty. Students will be required to write a personal statement as part of their application. Admission is selective and based on G.P.A., the personal statement, and an interview with social work faculty.
Department: College of Behavioral and Health Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) is a professional degree designed to prepare students for generalist social work practice. The curriculum prepares students to work with diverse populations in various social service settings. Social work is a profession for those who are committed to promoting social justice and human rights, enhancing individual and social well-being, alleviating poverty, and enhancing the quality of life for all people. The MTSU B.S.W. program is committed to a liberal arts perspective, social justice, and respect for diversity. The program prepares students for beginning professional generalist social work practice and for graduate study in social work and related fields. The program educates students about social welfare policy and services, human behavior in the social environment, social work practice methods, research, and field experience.
Accredidation: The MTSU Bachelor of Social Work (B.S.W.) Program is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) Commission on Accreditation. Initial Accreditation was granted in Spring 2021. For more information, you may contact the CSWE.
